analyzed: 'jam dpal de la phyag 'tshal lo // blo dman gyur kyang dad tsam gyis //

analyzed: yang dag bskul nas 'gro ba rnams //

original: rtogs dka' ba dang don che ba'i //

analyzed: lhag ma go sla rang nyid go // gang yang lhag dang chad ba'am //

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni sdud par byed pa bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyis gcig tu brgyud de thos pa la sbyor ba ma yin pa dang / gtam 'di ni bdag gis dngos su thos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni sdud par byed pa bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyis gcig tu brgyud de thos pa la sbyor ba ma yin pa dang / gtam 'di ni bdag gis dngos su thos pa yin gyi /
translated: By me refers to the compiler himself, who is inseparable from the fully enlightened Amitabha, and is not connected to the lineage of hearing. This story is something that I have heard directly,

original: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: but it is not something that I myself have done.

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni sgra so sor snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni sgra so sor snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud rtogs pa'o //

original: dris pa / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na rdo rje chos kyi mnyan la sogs pa 'gal lo zhe na /

translated: Question: Since the nature of Vajradhara is the state of manifest, complete buddhahood, it is contradictory to say that he is the listener of Vajradharma and so on.

analyzed: gdul ba'i thabs kyi dbang gis gcig pu nyid kyang dpag tu med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavān, by the power of the methods of taming the various realms and thoughts of sentient beings, engages in the manner of being immeasurable, even though he is alone.

original: bltams pa dang mngon par byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod par mdzad pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //

translated: This is like the birth, renunciation, performance of austerities, manifest enlightenment, turning the wheel of dharma, and so on.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mos pa sna tshogs bsam pa tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs bsam pa tha dad pa'i //

analyzed: thams cad lan gcig yang dag par rig pa yin te /

analyzed: des na thos pa mang bar grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase.🔽The Buddha heard this teaching at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug ste /
translated: The Bhagavat is the six qualities of mastery, etc.

original: 'dir ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la skal ba zhes bshad de de gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la skal ba zhes bshad de de gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Here, the nature of the mirror-like, equality, etc. is called fortune, and he who possesses that is called the Bhagavat.

original: yang na bcom pas bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad de //
analyzed: yang na bcom pas bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad de //
translated: Or else, he is called the Bhagavat because he has destroyed,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has destroyed the demon of the afflictions, etc.

original: de yang / nyon mongs shes rab la rag las //
analyzed: de yang / nyon mongs shes rab la rag las //
translated: Moreover, it is said: The afflictions depend on wisdom,

original: de bas shes rab bcom par bshad //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud de /
analyzed: de bas shes rab bcom par bshad // ces gsungs pa'i phyir phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud de /
translated: therefore wisdom is said to be the destroyer.

original: bzhi po 'joms pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo la bcom pa zhes bshad la /
analyzed: bzhi po 'joms pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo la bcom pa zhes bshad la /
translated: Because of this, the essence of the wisdom that destroys the four demons of the aggregates, of death, of the son of the gods, and of the afflictions is called the destroyer,

original: de gang la mnga' ba de ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: de gang la mnga' ba de ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: and he who possesses that is the Bhagavat.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
translated: It is the vajra of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bla na med pa'i chos ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas kyi khyad par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bla na med pa'i chos ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas kyi khyad par ston pa yin te /
translated: By the words “the secret of all the Tathagatas” and so on, he teaches the special abode that is in accord with the teaching of the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni gzhan dag gi spyod yul ma yin pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas are secret because they are not the domain of others.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje @162b ste mi phyed pa dang 'tshe ba med pa dang / yang dag pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid ni snying po ste de rnams kyi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje @162b ste mi phyed pa dang 'tshe ba med pa dang / yang dag pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid ni snying po ste de rnams kyi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That itself is the vajra, which is indivisible, harmless, and the essence of the true meaning. The nature of those is non-different.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad du gtogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rab tu snang zhing 'byung bar nges par 'brel bas na gcig pu nyid yin yang
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad du gtogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rab tu snang zhing 'byung bar nges par 'brel bas na gcig pu nyid yin yang
translated: In those bhagas of the queens who have such a nature, all things belonging to the animate and inanimate worlds appear and arise as the mandala circle. Although it is one,

original: tshig mang por byas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig mang por byas pa yin no //
translated: it is expressed in many words.

original: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa'i ngo bo nyid du mdzad pas na 'di nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa'i ngo bo nyid du mdzad pas na 'di nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: “Abiding” means that by the method of desire and so forth, all conduct of desire and so forth is made to have the nature of manifest enlightenment as desire and so forth. This is the deeds of the Tathagata.

original: sngon byung ba gtso bor mdzad pa ni ma yin /
analyzed: sngon byung ba gtso bor mdzad pa ni ma yin /
translated: It is not that he is the principal one of the past.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams kyang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis de yang dag par rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams kyang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis de yang dag par rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The past and so forth are also the present, because they are the perfect knowledge of that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gcig nas gcig tu mngon sum du //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu mngon sum du //
translated: One after another, in direct perception,

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu nyid gyur pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu nyid gyur pa'i //
translated: The cause becomes the effect itself.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang yin //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang yin //
translated: Whatever form there is in the present,

original: de ni rnal 'byor pa yin shes //🔽zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor pa yin shes // zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: That is known by the yogi.

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Inconceivable” and so forth indicates the retinue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa yang brjod par nus pa ma yin pas na brjod kyis mi lang ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa yang brjod par nus pa ma yin pas na brjod kyis mi lang ba ste /
translated: Since it is not possible to express the bodhisattvas, etc., it is “inexpressible.”

original: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, he says “buddha-field,” etc.

original: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the knowledge of all things in all modes.

original: der ni nyid la sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: der ni nyid la sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: In that, the one who is a hero of thought is a bodhisattva.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don la zhugs pas na sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don la zhugs pas na sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: He is a great hero because he is engaged in the welfare of a great multitude of beings.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Together with them, I heard this.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de rnams kyi nang nas mngon par rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa cung zad cig ston te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de rnams kyi nang nas mngon par rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa cung zad cig ston te /
translated: In this way, etc., he teaches a little of what is in accordance with his own realization, from among those [teachings].

original: de las kyang mi g-yo ba dang / rdo rje dang / byams pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor ba nyid du bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang mi g-yo ba dang / rdo rje dang / byams pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor ba nyid du bkag pa yin no //
translated: From that, he excludes Acala, Vajrapāṇi, Maitreya, etc., as being in the mandala.

original: dris pa rgyud 'dir so sor nges pa nyid du bstan na /
analyzed: dris pa rgyud 'dir so sor nges pa nyid du bstan na /
translated: If the questions are taught individually in this Tantra,

original: sems dpa' de rnams ji ltar brjod kyis mi lang ba yin /
analyzed: sems dpa' de rnams ji ltar brjod kyis mi lang ba yin /
translated: how can those heroes be said to be inexpressible?

original: de ltar mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar mod kyi /
translated: Even so,

original: de rnams re re nyid rang rang dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas /
analyzed: de rnams re re nyid rang rang dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas /
translated: each of them is the lord of the deities of his own mandala,

original: gtso bo nyid yin pas na grangs @163a * //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid yin pas na grangs @163a * //
translated: and so they are the principal ones.🔽Thus, the number is definite.

original: nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dgongs so //
analyzed: nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de bas na de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the words “and so forth” are mentioned.

original: de la gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje gang gis gzugs la yang dag par blta zhing so sor shes pa de ni dam tshig rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de la gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje gang gis gzugs la yang dag par blta zhing so sor shes pa de ni dam tshig rdo rje ste /
translated: Therein, the pledge-vajra is that by which one sees and individually cognizes form with the nondual vajra.

original: mig rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: mig rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid sa'i snying po'o //
translated: It is the essence of the purified eye, i.e., Kṣitigarbha.

original: chos kyi brda'i dbang gis na dam tshig ste rdo rje'i sgras ni sa'i snying po lta bu nyid ting nge 'dzin 'dir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi brda'i dbang gis na dam tshig ste rdo rje'i sgras ni sa'i snying po lta bu nyid ting nge 'dzin 'dir bshad pa yin no //
translated: The pledge is by the power of the symbol of the Dharma, and the vajra-sound is the explanation of this samādhi, i.e., Kṣitigarbha.

original: de bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgras kyang nye bar dgod pa lngas phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi khyad par yin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgras kyang nye bar dgod pa lngas phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi khyad par yin pa'am /
translated: Similarly, the terms vajra body and so on are also special pledges of Vajrapani and so on, because they are the five close seals,

original: sgra de dag brdar btags pa yin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / kun du bzang po rim pa ci lta ba bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra de dag brdar btags pa yin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / kun du bzang po rim pa ci lta ba bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
translated: or because those terms are conventional symbols, and so Vajrapani, Akashagarbha, Lokeshvara, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Samantabhadra are explained in that order.

original: 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni /
translated: These🔽indicate the order taught by Buddhajnana in such lines as:🔽Earth-heart, Vajrapani,

original: sa yi snying po phyag na rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'i rim pa ston par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sa yi snying po phyag na rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'i rim pa ston par gyur pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: gang yang dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgra'i tshig gdon mi za bar 'grub pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sde tshogs su tshig gi sbyor bas de'i rigs kyi bdag po rnams kyi nye bar gdags par sgrib pa rnam par
analyzed: gang yang dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgra'i tshig gdon mi za bar 'grub pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sde tshogs su tshig gi sbyor bas de'i rigs kyi bdag po rnams kyi nye bar gdags par sgrib pa rnam par
translated: Also, the words of the mantra, such as “I am the vajra of commitment,” are taught to be the names of the lords of the families of the Tathagatas, such as Sarvanivarana Viskambini, etc., in order to definitely accomplish the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: sel ba la sogs pa bstan to zhes bshad mod kyi de rnams kyi dka' bar 'byin pa 'dis kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i rim pa las brgal ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sel ba la sogs pa bstan to zhes bshad mod kyi de rnams kyi dka' bar 'byin pa 'dis kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i rim pa las brgal ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it should be said that the purpose of this difficult explanation is to surpass the stages of Samantabhadra, etc.

original: yang rigs dang 'brel pa nyid du bstan pa dgos pa ma yin nam zhes zer na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rigs dang 'brel pa nyid du bstan pa dgos pa ma yin nam zhes zer na ma yin te /
translated: Again, if it is said that the teaching of the connection with the family is not necessary, it is not so.

original: 'di ni 'di'i rigs las skyes pa yin no zhes de lta bu 'dir nges pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽man ngag la nges pa yod par rtogs so zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rigs las skyes pa yin no zhes de lta bu 'dir nges pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // man ngag la nges pa yod par rtogs so zhes zer na /
translated: Because there is no certainty here in this way, “This is born from this family.”

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that the instruction is understood to be certain, it is not so.

original: brtag pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtag pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is a consideration, because it is an affliction.

original: 'di ni 'og nas rigs kyi nges pa ston bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas rigs kyi nges pa ston bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that this is because the certainty of the family is being taught below.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa 'di dag kyang nang gi skye mched rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa 'di dag kyang nang gi skye mched rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
translated: These, the essence of the earth and so forth, are the nature of the pure inner sense bases.

original: de byin gyis brlab pa nyid nye bar sgrub pa la dgos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de byin gyis brlab pa nyid nye bar sgrub pa la dgos pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the purpose is to establish the blessing of that,

original: dkyil 'khor pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te @163b rgyud las rang gi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo gdon pa bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽sa rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi'i sgras ni sa dang / snying rje dang / thabs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te @163b rgyud las rang gi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo gdon pa bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro // sa rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi'i sgras ni sa dang / snying rje dang / thabs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma ste /
translated: not the mandala itself, because the tantra does not teach the extraction of the intrinsic signs and the intrinsic nature of meditative concentration.

original: lha mo bzhi rim bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lha mo bzhi rim bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The four phrases beginning with “the vajra of earth” indicate the four goddesses, Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā, respectively, who are the purities of the earth, compassion, method, and so forth.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni chos 'byung bar khang pa brtsegs ma la sogs pa rten dang brten pa'i gzugs can nam mkha'i rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni chos 'byung bar khang pa brtsegs ma la sogs pa rten dang brten pa'i gzugs can nam mkha'i rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: Space-vajra indicates the form of the celestial mansion and so forth, which is the support and the supported, in the shape of space, within the source of phenomena.

original: nam mkha' ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rdo rje ste /
translated: Space is a vajra.

original: dmigs su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is pure by nature as the wisdom that is not an object of perception.

original: 'di rdo rje 'dzin pa yin par ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di rdo rje 'dzin pa yin par ni mi 'dod de /
translated: It is not asserted that this is the holder of the vajra.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is explained that abides is the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: yang na de bdag nyid dang lhan cig byed pa po nyid du ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na de bdag nyid dang lhan cig byed pa po nyid du ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, it is not that he is the agent of that nature.

original: 'dir brje ba mdzad du zin kyang tha mi dad de /
analyzed: 'dir brje ba mdzad du zin kyang tha mi dad de /
translated: Even though he is the one who makes the exchange here, he is not different.

original: dper na mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gang yang nang gi ni nam mkha'i rang gi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin zhes chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i khyad par bshad pa der yang nang gi nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pas de skad bshad do zhes🔽khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gang yang nang gi ni nam mkha'i rang gi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin zhes chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i khyad par bshad pa der yang nang gi nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pas de skad bshad do zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the vajra holder, the nature of inner space, is explained in that way.

original: yang na nang gi nam mkha'i ngo bo gang yin la rdo rje ste /
analyzed: yang na nang gi nam mkha'i ngo bo gang yin la rdo rje ste /
translated: Or else, the nature of inner space is a vajra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: and because it holds the tathāgatas and so on, it is the vajra holder.

original: gzugs rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug gis ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo drug po nyid rim gyis bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug gis ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo drug po nyid rim gyis bshad pa yin no ;
translated: The six beginning with “Rūpavajrā” explain the six goddesses such as Rūpavajrā, the nature of the purity of generosity and so on.

original: / da ni bshad zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs su bsdus pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni bshad zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs su bsdus pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the summary of the bodhisattvas who have been explained, it says:

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase and so forth means the following.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni 'dir gtso bo'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni 'dir gtso bo'i tshig ste /
translated: The word and so forth is a principal term here.

original: de bas na rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por gyur pa'i gtso bo nyid kyis na thams cad la brjod kyis mi lang ba nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por gyur pa'i gtso bo nyid kyis na thams cad la brjod kyis mi lang ba nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that all means all of them, since they are the principal ones who are the lords of their own maṇḍalas.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i dbyings dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston pa yin te /🔽'di ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po ci rigs par sems dang // zhe sdang dang / chos kyi @164a * //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i dbyings dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston pa yin te / 'di ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po ci rigs par sems dang // zhe sdang dang / chos kyi @164a * //
translated: Now, the phrase the tathāgatas in the realm of space and so forth teaches the tathāgatas.🔽One should understand that these are the five buddhas Akṣhobhya and so forth, respectively, the nature of the purities of mind, hatred, the phenomena element,

original: dbyings la sogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyings la sogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the gnosis of the phenomena element, and so forth.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir snga ma bzhin sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir snga ma bzhin sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word and so forth should be applied here as before.

original: de nyid kyis na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam pa zhes bya bas de rnams tshad med pa nyid du nye bar mtshon pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam pa zhes bya bas de rnams tshad med pa nyid du nye bar mtshon pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, equal to the realm of space indicates that they are immeasurable.

original: de ltar na gzhir gyur pa nam mkha'i rdo rje ma gtogs pa lha'i nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / 'byin pa'i sngags kyi dbang gis khro bo bzhi gleng gzhi'i le'u las bshad pa de nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhir gyur pa nam mkha'i rdo rje ma gtogs pa lha'i nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / 'byin pa'i sngags kyi dbang gis khro bo bzhi gleng gzhi'i le'u las bshad pa de nyid de /
translated: Thus, except for the earth-vajra woman, there are twenty-one deities, and the four wrathful ones, who are explained in the nidana chapter, are generated by the mantra.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga mngon par rtogs pa la nye bar dgos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga mngon par rtogs pa la nye bar dgos pa yin gyi /
translated: These twenty-five are necessary for the clear realization.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But not so for the desire king, etc.,

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dgos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lus bskyed pa'i tshogs pa'i so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dgos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lus bskyed pa'i tshogs pa'i so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their purification is not necessary and because they are determined in the collection that generates the body.

original: da ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa ston par mi mdzad pa ni shes rab kyis mngon par rlom pa rnams kyi dregs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa ston par mi mdzad pa ni shes rab kyis mngon par rlom pa rnams kyi dregs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to remove the pride of those who are conceited about wisdom, he does not teach the clear realization in stages.

original: dngos grub ni slob dpon la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir go rims 'chol bas mngon par ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos grub ni slob dpon la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir go rims 'chol bas mngon par ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that spiritual powers depend on the master, he teaches in a scrambled order.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas thugs la bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i tshig bzhis gnyis pa gsol ba'i tshig dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas thugs la bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i tshig bzhis gnyis pa gsol ba'i tshig dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: The second verse is consistent with the words of the supplication, beginning with then and ending with remained in his mind.

original: sems can rnams snod du gyur pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba sbyin pa'i don du /
analyzed: sems can rnams snod du gyur pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba sbyin pa'i don du /
translated: In order to make sentient beings fit vessels, he explains the method of bestowing initiation,

original: padma'i nang du dkyil 'khor sprul par bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs yang dag par mnyes pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: padma'i nang du dkyil 'khor sprul par bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs yang dag par mnyes pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: and in order to emanate the mandala in the lotus, he explains the complete satisfaction of wisdom and means.

original: rnam par snang mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Since he is Vairochana, he is Vairochana.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
translated: The mind of enlightenment is the vajra.

original: 'dod chags chen po ni rgya che ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni rgya che ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: Great passion is vast bliss.

original: de'i thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyis sems su gang gis khrid pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la rdo rje 'chang ba lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyis sems su gang gis khrid pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la rdo rje 'chang ba lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He entered into the meditative stabilization that is led into the mind by the method and wisdom aspects, as if he were Vajradhara.🔽He caused all those arrays of Tathagatas to enter into his own body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa de dag thams cad nyid kyi sku la zhugs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab yang dag par mnyes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa de dag thams cad nyid kyi sku la zhugs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab yang dag par mnyes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This means that in order to please wisdom,

original: 'dod chags can phal cher ni bud med kun dga' ba nyid dang por byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags can phal cher ni bud med kun dga' ba nyid dang por byed pa yin la /
translated: it is the case that for the most part those who are passionate first make love to a woman.🔽And the Bhagavat, by the very fact that he knows the ritual of the means of subduing the world, pleases wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i thabs kyi cho ga mkhyen pa nyid kyis shes rab yang dag par mnyes par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i thabs kyi cho ga mkhyen pa nyid kyis shes rab yang dag par mnyes par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is what he is thinking.

original: @164b gzhan dag ni gzugs la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa zhugs par mdzad pa yin no zhes zer mod kyi de ni mi rigs te byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rdzogs shing phyi dang nang gi gzugs la sogs pa thugs
analyzed: @164b gzhan dag ni gzugs la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa zhugs par mdzad pa yin no zhes zer mod kyi de ni mi rigs te byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rdzogs shing phyi dang nang gi gzugs la sogs pa thugs
translated: Others say that the Tathagata enters the array in order to generate form and so forth.

original: su chud pa la ni gzugs la sogs pa ma bsgrubs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su chud pa la ni gzugs la sogs pa ma bsgrubs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not correct, because for one who has perfected the vajra mind of enlightenment and has internalized form and so forth, there is no form and so forth to be accomplished.

original: la la ni sangs rgyas spyan lta bu zhes pa 'dir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad yin par don gyis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: la la ni sangs rgyas spyan lta bu zhes pa 'dir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad yin par don gyis shes par bya ste /
translated: Some say that in this context, Buddha is to be understood as Vairochana by implication.

original: de yang nyid kyi sku mdog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyid kyi sku mdog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: And he has the color of his own body.

original: la la ni spyan lta bu'o //🔽la la ni gzugs rdo rje lta bus mngon par byung nas rgya che ba'i bde bas 'jug cing /
analyzed: la la ni spyan lta bu'o // la la ni gzugs rdo rje lta bus mngon par byung nas rgya che ba'i bde bas 'jug cing /
translated: Some say that he is like an eye.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi rigs par zhugs so zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi rigs par zhugs so zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Some say that having arisen like a form vajra, he enters with vast bliss and enters into the accomplishment of his own kind.

original: de bzhin du 'di'i 'og nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang rang rang gi rigs dang rjes su mthun par m'a ma k'i la sogs pa lta bur ci rigs par byung nas zhugs so zhes mthun par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di'i 'og nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang rang rang gi rigs dang rjes su mthun par m'a ma k'i la sogs pa lta bur ci rigs par byung nas zhugs so zhes mthun par shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that below this, Akṣhobhya and so forth, in accordance with their respective families, arose in the form of Māmakī and so forth, and entered.

original: yang gdon mi za bar grub pa ni la la sgrol ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang gdon mi za bar grub pa ni la la sgrol ma lta bu ste /
translated: Again, there is the inevitable accomplishment, such as Tārā,

original: sku mdog ser po dang ldan pa dang la la ni reg gi ngo bo lta bu ste nyid kyi sku mdog lta gu dang ldan par phyung nas zhugs so zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: sku mdog ser po dang ldan pa dang la la ni reg gi ngo bo lta bu ste nyid kyi sku mdog lta gu dang ldan par phyung nas zhugs so zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: who arose with a yellow body color, and some, such as Sparśā, entered with a beautiful body color of their own. This is the difference.

original: sku mdog gnyis kyis phyung ba'i dgos pa ni bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul ba'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: sku mdog gnyis kyis phyung ba'i dgos pa ni bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul ba'i phyir yin te /
translated: The purpose of the two body colors is to tame the realm of sentient beings with various intentions.

original: ji ltar aindra n'i la ltar snang ba ni mi bskyod pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ji ltar aindra n'i la ltar snang ba ni mi bskyod pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The appearance like an indranīla gem is the stage of manifest enlightenment of Akṣhobhya.

original: rgyud gzhan dag las ni sa gnon gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa sku mdog ser po zhes bshad la /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag las ni sa gnon gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa sku mdog ser po zhes bshad la /
translated: In other tantras, it is explained that the yellow body has the mudra of touching the earth.

original: 'dir yang reg bya las skyes pa nyid bde ba chen po gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang reg bya las skyes pa nyid bde ba chen po gtso bo ste /
translated: Here, the great bliss born from the tactile is primary,

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir reg bya yin no //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir reg bya yin no //
translated: and it is taught that it is the cause of manifest enlightenment.🔽The end of the nine goddesses is explained, but Vajradhātvīśvarī is not mentioned.

original: lha mo dgu'i mthar thug par bshad kyi chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma gsungs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa rnam par dag pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: lha mo dgu'i mthar thug par bshad kyi chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma gsungs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa rnam par dag pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de dag nyid yin pa'am /
translated: This is because she is the purification of the form aggregate and mirror-like pristine awareness and so forth, and Vairochana and so forth.🔽Or, she is the emanation and withdrawal of the form of the earth element and so forth, and the form of Vajra-dānapāramitā and so forth.

original: sa'i khams kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i spyin gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'byin pa dang / 'jug pa dag las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i spyin gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'byin pa dang / 'jug pa dag las shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from the emanation and withdrawal of the form of the earth element and so forth, and the form of Vajra-dānapāramitā and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Bhagavān is the nature of all things.

original: dper na rtsa ba'i rgyud ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa me @165a * //
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba'i rgyud ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa me @165a * //
translated: For example, the root tantra is the pure gnosis of the Bhagavat Akshobhya, the mirror-like gnosis, and here it is the pure aggregate of consciousness.

original: long lta bu'i ye shes rnam par dag pa yin la 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: long lta bu'i ye shes rnam par dag pa yin la 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, everything is without fault.🔽How is it that the Victorious Ones are said to have emerged by taking on the form of goddesses?

original: ji ltar na rgyal ba rnams lha mo'i gzugs 'dzin pas phyung ngo zhes bya ba byung ba tsam gsungs na de rnams ni rang gi rigs par zhugs pa ji ltar gsungs /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyal ba rnams lha mo'i gzugs 'dzin pas phyung ngo zhes bya ba byung ba tsam gsungs na de rnams ni rang gi rigs par zhugs pa ji ltar gsungs /
translated: This is merely a way of saying that they entered their own families.

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang zhugs par gyur to zhes sngar gsungs pa de 'dir yang rjes su sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang zhugs par gyur to zhes sngar gsungs pa de 'dir yang rjes su sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is true, but the statement that they entered should be applied here as well.

original: phyi rol la bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyi rol la bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because it is an external activity.

original: phyi rol du gnas pa'i bud med kyi gzugs kyi tshogs mchog tu bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: phyi rol du gnas pa'i bud med kyi gzugs kyi tshogs mchog tu bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te ;
translated: The collection of external female forms is not the cause of supreme bliss.

original: lha mo'i gzugs rnams 'khyud pa'i rang gi rigs pa'i nang du zhugs par shugs kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i gzugs rnams 'khyud pa'i rang gi rigs pa'i nang du zhugs par shugs kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand implicitly that the goddesses enter into the families of their respective consorts.

original: de bas na 'di nyid ni le'u bco brgyad pa las bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid ni le'u bco brgyad pa las bshad de /
translated: Therefore, this is explained in the eighteenth chapter:

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis //
translated: By the method of great passion,

original: ye shes 'khor lo can rnams bsdu //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo can rnams bsdu //
translated: the wheel of gnosis is gathered.

original: lha mo dgu ni spros nas su //
analyzed: lha mo dgu ni spros nas su //
translated: Having emanated the nine goddesses,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la dgod //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la dgod //
translated: they are placed in the body of the victim.

original: ces bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: ces bya bar gnas so //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir gnas rnam par dag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir gnas rnam par dag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to introduce sentient beings, the teaching of the pure abode is

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pa yin te /
translated: taught by “Then, ” and so forth.

original: btsun mo'i bha ga la zhes bya ba ni btsun mo dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i bha ga la ste /
analyzed: btsun mo'i bha ga la zhes bya ba ni btsun mo dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i bha ga la ste /
translated: In the bhaga of the queen means in the bhaga of the union with the queen.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pas gcig pu nyid yin yang mang po'i tshig tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pas gcig pu nyid yin yang mang po'i tshig tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Although it is only one, the plural is used because it is endowed with Īśvara and so forth.

original: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rang gi khar bcug pa'i bde bar gshegs pa ma lus pa zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba byang chub kyi sems ni dam tshig chen po ste /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rang gi khar bcug pa'i bde bar gshegs pa ma lus pa zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba byang chub kyi sems ni dam tshig chen po ste /
translated: The so-called “great commitment maṇḍala” is the great commitment, which is the bodhicitta that arises from the path of the vajra, preceded by the entry of all the sugatas who have entered one’s mouth and melt into the form of the moon.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: That is the maṇḍala that arises from the transformation of that.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas rdul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas rdul dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since it is free from the faults of desire and so on, it is free from dust.

original: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid kyis ni gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid kyis ni gru bzhi'o //
translated: Since buddhas and non-buddhas are the same, it is square.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi gzhir gyur pas na gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi gzhir gyur pas na gsal ba'o //
translated: Since it is the basis of the reflection of all things, it is clear.

original: sra ba dang bar du gcod pa'i gnas med pas de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sra ba dang bar du gcod pa'i gnas med pas de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since it is not a place of solidity or obstruction, it is its nature.

original: sangs rgyas mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes pas sna tshogs gzugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes pas sna tshogs gzugs so //
translated: Since it obtains the gnosis of buddhahood, it is the form of diversity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyis rnam par spros pas na kun du sangs rgyas kyi sprin gyis kun du khyab pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @165b kyi 'od zer 'phro ba dang bsdu ba dang / gnas pa dang brtan par gyur pas kun du rtsol bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyis rnam par spros pas na kun du sangs rgyas kyi sprin gyis kun du khyab pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @165b kyi 'od zer 'phro ba dang bsdu ba dang / gnas pa dang brtan par gyur pas kun du rtsol bas na /
translated: It is a cloud of Buddhas, because it is pervaded by the emanations of the images of the Tathagatas.🔽It is a mass of light rays, because it is a mass of the light rays of the Tathagatas, which radiate, gather, abide, and become firm.

original: 'od zer 'phro ba mang po 'khrug / ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'phro ba mang po 'khrug / ces bya'o //
translated: It is a mandala of light rays, because it is a mandala of light rays, which are the light rays of the Tathagatas.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i gdan dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i gdan dang ldan pas na /
translated: It is a mandala of the moon, sun, etc., because it is endowed with the seats of the moon, sun, etc.

original: gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor ldan //
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor ldan //
translated: It is a mandala of the clear, etc., because it is endowed with the mandalas of the clear, etc.

original: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'brel bas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'brel bas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
translated: It is the abode of all the Tathagatas, because it is connected with the vajra of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the essence of all the Tathagatas.

original: thar pa'i gnas su gyur pas na gnas so //
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas su gyur pas na gnas so //
translated: It is the abode, because it is the abode of liberation.

original: chos 'byung ba'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the source of the Dharma.

original: de ltar phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par byung ba ltar nges par snang ba dang / dang po'i rdo rje 'chang ba gnyis lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis mtshungs par bsam gtan las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par byung ba ltar nges par snang ba dang / dang po'i rdo rje 'chang ba gnyis lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis mtshungs par bsam gtan las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the mandala that arises endowed with the four seals, and the two, the definite appearance and the first vajra-holder, are the same, it is explained, by the power of imagination.🔽Question: For all four yogins who arise from the creation stage, this mandala that is meditated as arisen from the cause that is their own appropriation is like that.

original: dris pa / bskyed pa'i rim pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa bzhi char la yang rang gi nye bar len pa ji lta ba'i rgyur gyur pa las byung bar bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin pa de bzhin du las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la mchod
analyzed: dris pa / bskyed pa'i rim pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa bzhi char la yang rang gi nye bar len pa ji lta ba'i rgyur gyur pa las byung bar bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin pa de bzhin du las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la mchod
translated: In the same way, the beginning yogins, having begun with the supreme worship of the buddhas,

original: pa dam pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: pa dam pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba'i ngo bo'i rgyu mthun pa chen po la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba'i ngo bo'i rgyu mthun pa chen po la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: purify the great natural outflow and so on, the essence of pleasing all the tathāgatas.

original: rang gi rigs pa'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus na gnas pa stong pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sa bon /
analyzed: rang gi rigs pa'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus na gnas pa stong pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sa bon /
translated: The seed, which is the nature of the enlightenment of emptiness, is located in the center of the mansion that is included within one's own body of reality.

original: lha'i rang gi ngo bo tsam du nges par snang ba bsam par bya ba'i 'khor lo'i nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rang gi ngo bo tsam du nges par snang ba bsam par bya ba'i 'khor lo'i nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: It is the appropriated cause of the wheel of contemplation, which appears as just the nature of the deity.

original: ye shes cung zad babs pas ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa thun mtshams rang gi sngags zlos pa ni rang gi lha'i sa bon sngar bsgoms pa brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes cung zad babs pas ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa thun mtshams rang gi sngags zlos pa ni rang gi lha'i sa bon sngar bsgoms pa brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recitation of one's own mantra between sessions is the seed of one's own deity, which was previously contemplated, because it is the nature of the reality of the Dharma, due to the descent of a little exalted wisdom.

original: ye shes la dbang thob pa dag kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu de'i stobs kyis rten dang brten par nges par snang ba la shin tu goms par bslabs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyus aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyi cha'i lhan cig
analyzed: ye shes la dbang thob pa dag kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu de'i stobs kyis rten dang brten par nges par snang ba la shin tu goms par bslabs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyus aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyi cha'i lhan cig
translated: Even those who have attained power over exalted wisdom, by the power of that appropriated cause, train in order to become very familiar with the appearance of the support and the supported, which arises from the power of the appropriated cause of the three parts of the three syllables om aḥ hūṃ.

original: byed pa'i rang gi sems las rgyu dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'khor lo bzhag la /🔽cung zad rgyun gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa yin te //
analyzed: byed pa'i rang gi sems las rgyu dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'khor lo bzhag la / cung zad rgyun gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa yin te //
translated: In one's own mind, which is the agent, all the subtle particles of animate and inanimate things are completely perfected in every way, serving as the cause for emanating and gathering.

original: thun mtshams @166a * //
analyzed: thun mtshams @166a * //
translated: One abides in the yoga of the slightly extended [recitation].

original: kyi nges pa de la brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi nges pa de la brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The measure of the session is to investigate that.🔽Also, one who has gained mastery over the wisdom of reality, through training in great familiarity, engages spontaneously.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes la dbang du gyur pa yang shin tu goms par bslabs pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas rdul phra rab re re zhing yang 'khor lo dam pa gsum chud cing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes la dbang du gyur pa yang shin tu goms par bslabs pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas rdul phra rab re re zhing yang 'khor lo dam pa gsum chud cing /
translated: Each subtle particle contains the three sacred wheels,🔽and each has the nature of being a reflection of the other.

original: phan tshun du gzugs brnyan du gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs can bdag nyid thams cad du gtogs pa /🔽skad cig ma'i rkyen dang bral ba /
analyzed: phan tshun du gzugs brnyan du gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs can bdag nyid thams cad du gtogs pa / skad cig ma'i rkyen dang bral ba /
translated: They are endowed with all aspects of form.🔽They are free from the condition of being momentary.

original: dri ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba /
translated: They arise from stainless samādhi.

original: bde ba'i nga rgyal gyis rgyas par bsgom par bya zhing 'gro ba'i don bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i nga rgyal gyis rgyas par bsgom par bya zhing 'gro ba'i don bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the expansion of the pride of bliss and work for the welfare of the world.

original: lhun gyis grub par thob cing /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par thob cing /
translated: One attains spontaneously,🔽and one becomes constant in the application of each instant.

original: skad cig ma re re'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i rtag par gyur pa yin te zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i rtag par gyur pa yin te zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough with the digression.

original: sems can rnams gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the entry of sentient beings into the secret mandala, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so forth.

original: gzhug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams zhes bya bar las kyi tshig tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams zhes bya bar las kyi tshig tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: “ They entered” should be seen as a verbal action of “sentient beings,”

original: gsol ba gdab pa gnyis pa'i tshig gi don ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa gnyis pa'i tshig gi don ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the meaning of the words of the second supplication.

original: da ni sems can rnams la gzhug pa tsam gyis de kho na nyid sngags kyi sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / gsang ba dang bcas pa yi ge'i phyag rgya rnams kyis rab tu sbas pa yang smra bar rigs pa ma yin pas dbang bskur bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sems can rnams la gzhug pa tsam gyis de kho na nyid sngags kyi sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / gsang ba dang bcas pa yi ge'i phyag rgya rnams kyis rab tu sbas pa yang smra bar rigs pa ma yin pas dbang bskur bar bya ba'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to confer initiation,🔽he declares, “Then, the five victors, abiding in the mind,🔽the supreme bliss, and the means of accomplishment,🔽emerge from the syllable hūṃ, etc.,

original: thugs la zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um la sogs pa las byung ba dang / sgrub pa ste gnyis ka yang mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa la rgyal ba lnga po bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs la zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um la sogs pa las byung ba dang / sgrub pa ste gnyis ka yang mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa la rgyal ba lnga po bzhugs pa'o //
translated: and are placed in the five places.”

original: de ltar na 'di thams cad thob pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di thams cad thob pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not proper to attain all of this,

original: sngar gyi 'dod chags chen po'i tshul //
analyzed: sngar gyi 'dod chags chen po'i tshul //
translated: since it is the method of great passion.

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gcig bu nyid las gzhan dag ni ma thos pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur rtsom pa la ting nge 'dzin gang sems can rnam par dag pa'i rgyu dang / dbang bskur ba dag ni bcu bdun pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gcig bu nyid las gzhan dag ni ma thos pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur rtsom pa la ting nge 'dzin gang sems can rnam par dag pa'i rgyu dang / dbang bskur ba dag ni bcu bdun pa las /
translated: The seventeen initiations are the cause of the purification of sentient beings, and the initiations are extensively explained in the seventeenth chapter, beginning with the words,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa phyag na rdo rje 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad kyi dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa phyag na rdo rje 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad kyi dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then the bhagavat tathagata Vajrapani entered the concentration called the glory of all desired enjoyments.

original: de dang lhan cig pa nyid du tshig bzhi pa 'di'i don /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa nyid du tshig bzhi pa 'di'i don /
translated: The meaning of this four line verse is explained in the Sadhana of Samantabhadra, beginning with the words,

original: mchog tu rjes chags phun tshogs dpag med kyis //
analyzed: mchog tu rjes chags phun tshogs dpag med kyis //
translated: By the infinite perfection of supreme passion,

original: zhes bya ba la @166b sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis kun du bzang po'i sgrub pa'i thabs las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @166b sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis kun du bzang po'i sgrub pa'i thabs las bshad pa yin no //
translated: and so forth, in four verses.

original: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis tshig gnyis pas gsol ba gdab pa gnyis pa dang yang dag par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis tshig gnyis pas gsol ba gdab pa gnyis pa dang yang dag par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Now, from “thereupon” up to “remained” is the second supplication, which is connected with the second verse.🔽The explanation of the two aspects of the teacher is by way of the body, which is connected with the five manifest enlightenments. The vajra of enlightenment mind is the indivisibility of emptiness and mind vajra, which is the Bhagavat.🔽The vajra samādhi is the samādhi of the Bhagavat, who is the vajra of all tathāgatas, who is the vajra of all buddhas, and who is the vajra of all bodhisattvas.🔽The vajra of all tathāgatas is the Bhagavat, who is the indivisibility of emptiness and the mind vajra.

original: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga dang 'brel ba sku bstan pas ston pa'i rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang thugs rdo rje dbyer mi phyed pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga dang 'brel ba sku bstan pas ston pa'i rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang thugs rdo rje dbyer mi phyed pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //

translated: The vajra of all tathāgatas is the Bhagavat, who is the indivisibility of emptiness and the mind vajra.🔽The

original: phyed pa'i tshig gi don ni nges pa med pa yin pas na /
analyzed: phyed pa'i tshig gi don ni nges pa med pa yin pas na /
translated: The meaning of the word “half” is indefinite,
