translated: so the first meaning is made the sixth.

original: zhugs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: zhugs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: “Immediately upon entering” means immediately after the Bhagavat entered into meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid yin pas nam mkha'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid yin pas nam mkha'i dbyings so //
translated: This lord of all tathāgatas is equal to space, so it is the realm of space.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sku dang dbyangs dang / mtshan yongs su gyur nas zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par zhu bar gyur pa la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sku dang dbyangs dang / mtshan yongs su gyur nas zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par zhu bar gyur pa la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs so //
translated: Then, having arisen from the meditative concentration of overpowering, all tathāgatas, having transformed their bodies, voices, and marks into the form of two moons, were called the vajra sound of all tathāgatas.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de'i rang bzhin du gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de'i rang bzhin du gnas par gyur to //
translated: Their nature is their essence.

original: 'di dag gis bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa yin no //🔽rgyud 'dir dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis so zhes bya ba la nyes pa med du zin kyang stong pa nyid dang thugs rje chen po dbyer mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can du gyur bar bcom ldan 'das nye
analyzed: 'di dag gis bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa yin no // rgyud 'dir dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis so zhes bya ba la nyes pa med du zin kyang stong pa nyid dang thugs rje chen po dbyer mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can du gyur bar bcom ldan 'das nye
translated: These explain the verse beginning “arising from the collection of sixteen parts.🔽” Although there is no fault in saying that the two moons are the transformation of the vowels and consonants in this tantra, the Bhagavān is perceived as🔽having the nature of the thought of awakening, which is the indivisibility of

original: bar dmigs te /
analyzed: bar dmigs te /
translated: emptiness and great compassion.🔽Moreover, since that is primordially unborn, it is said that “A is the door

original: de yang gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de yang gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas na /
translated: of all dharmas.”🔽Thus, the Bhagavān teaches the pride that has the nature of the complete

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge ni dngos po ma lus par rab tu 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi nga rgyal ston pa @167a * //🔽nyid kyis ston te /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge ni dngos po ma lus par rab tu 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi nga rgyal ston pa @167a * // nyid kyis ston te /
translated: cessation of all things, which is the nature of the letters A and so on.🔽Therefore, the Bhagavān teaches that the generation stage is the cause

original: de bas na de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas rgyur gyur ba yin par bcom ldan 'das ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas rgyur gyur ba yin par bcom ldan 'das ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: for that.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong par gyur pa la lar rnam pa la sogs par nges par snang ba'i tshul rang gi sems so sor rtog pa yi ge aa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong par gyur pa la lar rnam pa la sogs par nges par snang ba'i tshul rang gi sems so sor rtog pa yi ge aa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu ste /
translated: The letter A is the cause of the moon-disk, which is the discernment of one’s mind in the manner of appearing as if ascertained as a form, etc.

original: de nyid ni la lar bsdu bar byas te /
analyzed: de nyid ni la lar bsdu bar byas te /
translated: That very [moon-disk] is, in some cases, contracted,

original: shes rab dam par nges par snang zhing mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dam par nges par snang zhing mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: appearing as if ascertained as the highest wisdom, and the cause of generating the highest bliss.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not possible to teach the nature of the moon-disk by way of its being the cause of emptiness,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyi ka la sogs par nges par snang ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyi ka la sogs par nges par snang ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the enlightenment mind, which is the nature of compassion, is the cause of the second moon-disk, appearing as if ascertained as the letters Ka, etc.

original: de nyid thabs su snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba'i stobs kyis yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid thabs su snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba'i stobs kyis yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: That very [enlightenment mind] is the cause of the appearance of method, which is transformed by the power of the activity for the welfare of transmigrating beings.

original: de bas na rgyud gzhan las bshad pa'i don rjes su mthun pa med pas 'dus pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yi ge nyid kyis kyang gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rgyud gzhan las bshad pa'i don rjes su mthun pa med pas 'dus pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yi ge nyid kyis kyang gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no concordant meaning explained in other tantras, it is also just a transformation by the very syllables that are concordant with the Guhyasamāja.

original: bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: The one called Buddhajñānapāda explains the sixteen parts and the arising from the assembly, and so on.

original: tshig bzhi pa dang 'brel ba'i lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa dang 'brel ba'i lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the fifth [syllable] connected with the fourth [syllable],

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de nas zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de nas zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “then,” and so on. “ Then” is immediately after the empowerment.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad na gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs pa'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad na gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs pa'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
translated: “ Abiding in all the realm of space” means abiding in the middle of the kūṭāgāra included in the natural family-jewel-source.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i byin gyis rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pas yin gyi /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i byin gyis rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pas yin gyi /
translated: Vajrasattva's blessing refers to the consecration obtained through the prior entry of all the tathagatas.🔽

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase through the blessing of Vajrasattva means that one obtains the empowerment that is preceded by the entry of all the Ones-Gone-Thus, and not by the power of the conditions that were just explained,

original: grol ba nyid du thal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba nyid du thal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that one would be liberated.

original: dbyangs la sogs par nges par snang ba yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis yongs su gyur pa'i gzugs can gyi rnam pa gzhan du gyur ba ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyangs la sogs par nges par snang ba yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis yongs su gyur pa'i gzugs can gyi rnam pa gzhan du gyur ba ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The transformation of the two moons that appear as definitely being the vowels and so forth into a form that is a transformation is stated in the three lines beginning with the words then the body of the Tathagata.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: Then means immediately after the two moons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni re re zhing ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir @167b rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni re re zhing ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir @167b rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is a vajra because each is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rgyal ba thams cad kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid de de nyid rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rgyal ba thams cad kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid de de nyid rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The commitment of those is the very thing not to be transgressed by all the victors, and that very thing is Vajradhara.

original: de 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste /
translated: The arising of that is the generation.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang las zla ba gnyis yang dag par rig pa rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can dbyer mi phyed par gyur pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang las zla ba gnyis yang dag par rig pa rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can dbyer mi phyed par gyur pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad pa'o //
translated: The samādhi in which the two moons, which have the characteristic of one-pointed awareness, become inseparable, is the one-pointed mind.

original: rig pa dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i skyes bu'i gzugs kyang yin la /
analyzed: rig pa dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i skyes bu'i gzugs kyang yin la /
translated: It is also the form of the person who is truly endowed with awareness,

original: chen po yang yin pas na /
analyzed: chen po yang yin pas na /
translated: and it is also great,

original: rig pa'i skyes bu chen po'i gzugs te /
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu chen po'i gzugs te /
translated: therefore it is the form of the great person of awareness.

original: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: By that very thing, all the tathāgatas are empowered by mantra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
translated: Since they are also tathāgatas,

original: sngags kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ste /
analyzed: sngags kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ste /
translated: and they are also mantras, they are the mantras of all tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyis rlabs ni rgyud de byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyis rlabs ni rgyud de byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Their blessings are the blessings of those tantras.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid ces bya ba ni gang 'di zil gyis gnon pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sngar bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid ces bya ba ni gang 'di zil gyis gnon pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sngar bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One himself is the one who previously dwelt in the samādhi of conquest.

original: zhal gsum pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po lta bu'o //
translated: Like a three-faced one is like a white, black, and red one.

original: 'di dag kyang nga rgyal de ldan zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽rgyal ba skyed byed nyid kyi sku ru bsam //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang nga rgyal de ldan zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / rgyal ba skyed byed nyid kyi sku ru bsam //
translated: These are also connected with the text beginning with “endowed with that pride”

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung dang sbyor ro //
translated: and ending with “imagine the body that gives rise to the victors.”

original: lnga pa'i rjes thogs kyi tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lnga pa'i rjes thogs kyi tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the words that follow the fifth one,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “then” and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba thob pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba thob pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: Then means immediately after attaining bliss and mental bliss.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs su gtogs shing /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs su gtogs shing /
translated: Akshobhya and so on means belonging to the family of Akshobhya.

original: de sa bon las skyes pa'i sems can la 'dir mi bskyod pa'i sgrar gzung gi bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de sa bon las skyes pa'i sems can la 'dir mi bskyod pa'i sgrar gzung gi bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The sentient beings born from the seed are referred to here as Akṣhobhya, but not those who arise by the power of meditation,

original: de ni rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are complete.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang shes par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: de thog ma byas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de thog ma byas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is the beginning, etc.

original: chos kyi dbyings rdo rje'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rdo rje'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the ultimate vajra element of the realm of phenomena.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: sems can rigs de dang de zla ba zhu bar gyur pa'i de kho na nyid kyis dbang bskur zhing sa bon de yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma'i rim gyis de dang de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas thugs ka nas zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i chos 'byung ba gnas
analyzed: sems can rigs de dang de zla ba zhu bar gyur pa'i de kho na nyid kyis dbang bskur zhing sa bon de yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma'i rim gyis de dang de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas thugs ka nas zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i chos 'byung ba gnas
translated: The sentient beings of that and that family, by the reality of the moon’s melting, are consecrated, and by the sign of the complete transformation of the seed, they become that and that tathāgata.🔽The statement “from the heart” means that the knowledge-mantra arises from the abode of the dharma-dhātu-vajra element.

original: so // ched kar rjod pas na ched du @168a * //
analyzed: so // ched kar rjod pas na ched du @168a * //
translated: Since it is uttered for the sake of, it is a declaration.

original: brjod pa'o // ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'o // ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste /
translated: “Amazing!” is a sense of wonder.

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems nyid zla ba zhu ba zhes bya bar rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang gis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems nyid zla ba zhu ba zhes bya bar rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The bodhicitta itself, by virtue of its various forms in accordance with the disciples, is the “melting of the moon.”

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
translated: Since this is the case for all the Tathāgatas, it is “of all the Tathāgatas.”

original: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: Since it is not the domain of others, it is “secret.”

original: rtag pa'i don gyi ma rig pa'i tshul can ngang gis 'byung ba'i chos kyis spangs pa yin pas na rab tu mi rtog ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i don gyi ma rig pa'i tshul can ngang gis 'byung ba'i chos kyis spangs pa yin pas na rab tu mi rtog ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is naturally arisen, it is “non-conceptual,” in the sense of being free from the ignorance that is the mode of the meaning of permanence.

original: de nyid kyis na dri ma med pas na rnyog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dri ma med pas na rnyog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is just that, it is “unpolluted,” in the sense of being stainless.

original: 'dis ni / sa yi snying po phyag na rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas bshad pa'i don la bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni / sa yi snying po phyag na rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas bshad pa'i don la bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the meaning of the five verses beginning with “Kṣitigarbha, Vajrapāṇi,” and so on.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das phal cher gsol ba 'debs pa sngon du 'gro bas chos ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das phal cher gsol ba 'debs pa sngon du 'gro bas chos ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the Lord teaches the Dharma with the request of the majority of the assembly as a prelude,

original: tshig dang po gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig dang po gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the first verse is stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The worship of all the Tathagatas is Rupavajrā and so forth.

original: des sangs rgyas pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings khyab pa'o //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings khyab pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas are pervaded by the realm of space.

original: de nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig ste rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig ste rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: That itself is the commitment of reality, which is Vajradhara.

original: de nyid ni rin thang med pas na rin po che'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rin thang med pas na rin po che'o //
translated: That itself is a jewel because it is priceless.

original: de'i sprin gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i sprin gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The cloud of that is to be supplied.

original: 'dus pa ni 'du bar mdzad pa ste bshad ma thag pa'i gsang ba las byung ba ni rgyu ste 'di ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni 'du bar mdzad pa ste bshad ma thag pa'i gsang ba las byung ba ni rgyu ste 'di ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gsol pa'o //
translated: The assembly is the one who assembles, and the cause of the just-mentioned emergence from the secret is this, which is the request of the creation stage.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The vajras are the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi snying po gang du btus pa de ni 'byin pa'i sngags kyi tshogs sam /
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po gang du btus pa de ni 'byin pa'i sngags kyi tshogs sam /
translated: The collection of the mantras that are extracted in that which is compiled from the essence of those is the collection of the mantras that are extracted in that which is compiled from the essence of those.

original: de'i don yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is the meaning, and so it is called that.

original: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That itself is called the secret of all the Tathagatas,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the sphere of activity of the Sravakas, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul te nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul te nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: That itself is the manner of the complete result, which is the twenty-fifth.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request for the complete result.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang the tshom skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dag tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sa 'og ma pa rnams 'khor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang the tshom skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dag tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sa 'og ma pa rnams 'khor bar byed pa ste /
translated: All the Tathagatas also generate doubt, i.e., those who have attained manifest enlightenment in other continuums, who are below the stage, cause them to wander in cyclic existence.

original: de rnams ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yang / gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis //🔽rnal 'byor pa yang sun 'byin to //
analyzed: de rnams ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de yang / gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis // rnal 'byor pa yang sun 'byin to //
translated: That is because they have not realized reality.🔽And that is also by the method

original: @168b zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: @168b zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: of the yogis being refuted by the higher and higher distinctions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag lta shin tu smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag lta shin tu smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention other bodhisattvas?

original: chos 'di ni the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is the cause of doubt.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na dngos su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang na dngos su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams the tshom gyi rgyur gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, in fact, the Tathagatas are not the cause of doubt.

original: 'on kyang chos nyid kyis shin tu zab par bstan pa'i mchog gi tshig 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos nyid kyis shin tu zab par bstan pa'i mchog gi tshig 'di yin no //
translated: However, this is the supreme statement of the teaching of the extremely profound reality.

original: spyi tsam gyis dam pa ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: spyi tsam gyis dam pa ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: The supreme in general is the wonder.

original: mi srid par shes pa ni rmad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi srid par shes pa ni rmad du gyur pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the impossible is the marvel.

original: yang na ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: Or else, the wonder is the cause.

original: rmad du gyur pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rmad du gyur pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The marvel is the result.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa ni de kho na nyid mnyam pa'i snod du rung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa ni de kho na nyid mnyam pa'i snod du rung bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The blessing of all Tathagatas is making one a suitable vessel for the equality of reality.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje ste /
translated: The nature of all the Tathagatas is the vajra.

original: rdo rje gang yin pa las byung ba'i dam tshig ni yongs su dag pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang chu dang sman la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gang yin pa las byung ba'i dam tshig ni yongs su dag pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang chu dang sman la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commitment that arises from that vajra is the pure moon, sun, water, medicine, and so forth.

original: de las byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which arises from that is

original: gang gi tshe ming gi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ming gi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa la /
translated: when the name consecration and so forth

original: de rig ma'i padma'i khong na gnas pa'i 'khor lo la dbang bskur ba la sogs pas slob ma rnam par sbyangs te /
analyzed: de rig ma'i padma'i khong na gnas pa'i 'khor lo la dbang bskur ba la sogs pas slob ma rnam par sbyangs te /
translated: are conferred on the wheel that abides in the heart of the lotus of the knowledge woman, the disciples are purified by the consecration and so forth,

original: snod du rung bar byas nas yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snod du rung bar byas nas yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and having become suitable vessels, they are to be shown the reality.

original: 'di ni dang po'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the text that teaches the first yoga.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ston par byed pa dkyil 'khor 'byin pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bdun pas ston te /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ston par byed pa dkyil 'khor 'byin pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bdun pas ston te /
translated: Now, the seven lines beginning with “then” teach the emanation of the mandala, which is the teacher of the supreme mandala.

original: ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so ;
analyzed: ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so ;
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom of the dharmadhatu.

original: / de nyid ni 'od gsal ba yin pas na sgron ma'o //
analyzed: / de nyid ni 'od gsal ba yin pas na sgron ma'o //
translated: That is the light, and so it is the lamp.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pas rdo rjer gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje 'chang ba lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pas rdo rjer gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje 'chang ba lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: That is the vajra, because it is indivisible, and so it is the vajra-holding samādhi, like Vajradhara.

original: zhe sdang ni dgra bo'i rgyud dang de las yang dag par byung ba ral gri la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid la khro bo zhes bya ba'i zhe sdang ba nyid ni khro bo ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni dgra bo'i rgyud dang de las yang dag par byung ba ral gri la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid la khro bo zhes bya ba'i zhe sdang ba nyid ni khro bo ma yin te /
translated: He is the wrathful one, because he is the wrathful one who arises from the lineage of the enemy, and from that, who holds the sword and so forth.

original: khro bar ma gyur kyang dgra bo'i rgyu srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro bar ma gyur kyang dgra bo'i rgyu srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not wrathful, because he is not wrathful, but because the lineage of the enemy exists.

original: de nyid ni rigs kyang yin zhing bstan pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mgon po ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs kyang yin zhing bstan pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mgon po ste /
translated: He is the lord, because he is the lord who is the nature of the teachings.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags so //
translated: He is the mantra, because he is the mantra that has that nature.

original: de nyid ni grangs med pa'i rigs kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na mchog @169a * //
analyzed: de nyid ni grangs med pa'i rigs kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na mchog @169a * //
translated: He is the supreme, because he is the supreme that has the nature of the countless lineages.

original: go ; / mi g-yo bas na snying po'o //
analyzed: go ; / mi g-yo bas na snying po'o //
translated: He is the essence, because he is the essence that is immovable.

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rab tu stsol ba nyid kyis na snying po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rab tu stsol ba nyid kyis na snying po'o //
translated: He is the essence, because he is the essence that bestows the desired result.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained below.

original: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las zhes bya ba ni khyad par med kyang yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las zhes bya ba ni khyad par med kyang yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gis bstan pa'o //
translated: From his own body, speech, and mind vajras is taught by the distinction of the transformation, although there is no difference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, that itself and so forth is stated.

original: mi bskyod pa nyid phyag rgya chen pos rang snang ba'i rig pa dang yang dag par sbyor bas na phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa nyid phyag rgya chen pos rang snang ba'i rig pa dang yang dag par sbyor bas na phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
translated: Since he is united with the knowledge that is self-apparent through the great seal of Akshobhya, he is united with the great seal.

original: de nyid dpag tu med pa'i sprul pa'i gzugs kyi thabs kyi mchog gi 'jug pa'i mdzad pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid dpag tu med pa'i sprul pa'i gzugs kyi thabs kyi mchog gi 'jug pa'i mdzad pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since he pervades with the activity of engaging in the supreme method of an immeasurable emanation body, he is the great seal of Akshobhya.

original: las yin yang gsum par byas so //
analyzed: las yin yang gsum par byas so //
translated: Although it is an action, it is made into the third [case].

original: nag po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'i tshul du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nag po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'i tshul du zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the manner of black, white, and red, it is said.

original: nag po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: nag po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: Black is all aspects.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The right face is white.

original: g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
translated: The left face is red.

original: tshul 'dis na de nyid der bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshul 'dis na de nyid der bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By this method, he abides there.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang du thim par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang du thim par gyur pa'o ;
translated: and dissolves into oneself.

original: /'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: /'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of this

original: cho ga 'di yis sems ni bstan pa dang // zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: cho ga 'di yis sems ni bstan pa dang // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: is to be applied to the passage beginning with “The mind is taught by this rite”

original: dngos po thams cad kyis ni dbyung bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyis ni dbyung bar bya // zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and ending with “all things are to be brought forth.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni gzugs brnyan du shes pa 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni gzugs brnyan du shes pa 'byung zhing /
translated: The commitment of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the arising of the knowledge of the image.

original: skye ba gang du rdo rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin me long lta bu'i tshul nyid du gyur pa de nyid la snyoms par zhugs te phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye ba gang du rdo rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin me long lta bu'i tshul nyid du gyur pa de nyid la snyoms par zhugs te phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Wherever the birth of the vajra-nature, the meditative stabilization of the mirror-like mode, is brought forth, he entered into equipoise on just that and brought it forth.

original: gti mug ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gti mug ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of delusion:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, the mundane is characterized by ignorance and characterized by the view of the transitory collection.

original: de'i gnyen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo phyogs med par dngos po thams cad la bdag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshul gyi nga rgyal ni gti mug chen po ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo phyogs med par dngos po thams cad la bdag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshul gyi nga rgyal ni gti mug chen po ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the essence of nondual intuition, which is the pride that thinks “I am” in all things without partiality. That is the second great delusion.

original: de nyid ni rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That itself is the family, etc.

original: dkar po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: dkar po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The white is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: The right face is black.

original: g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
translated: The left face is red.

original: de nyid kyis na dzi na dzik / ces bya ba dang / sku rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dzi na dzik / ces bya ba dang / sku rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the Jinavajra, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo @169b po nyid kyi rin po che ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo @169b po nyid kyi rin po che ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The essence of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the intuition of equality.

original: de'i 'byung ba ni dngos po ma lus pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba ni dngos po ma lus pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Its emergence is the birth from all things.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i dpal yin pas na rdo rje dpal te /
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i dpal yin pas na rdo rje dpal te /
translated: That itself is the glory of indivisibility, therefore it is the glory-vajra.

original: ting 'dzin gang la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed par 'gyur bas ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin gang la bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed par 'gyur bas ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He entered the samādhi called “fulfilling all wishes,” because it fulfills all wishes.

original: nor bu yid bzhin nyid rigs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nor bu yid bzhin nyid rigs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling gem is the family, etc.

original: ser po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ser po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: Yellow is all aspects.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The left face is white.

original: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: The right face is black.

original: de nyid kyis na ratna dhrik / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na ratna dhrik / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That is why the verse beginning “ratna-dhṛk” is stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid 'dod chags chen po ste phyogs med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid 'dod chags chen po ste phyogs med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All tathāgatas themselves are great passion, because they are free from partiality.

original: de'i 'byung ba ni skye ba ste so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba ni skye ba ste so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Its arising is birth, which is the aspect of discernment.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed par ting nge 'dzin gang du gyur pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed par ting nge 'dzin gang du gyur pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That itself is the indivisible samādhi, in which he entered, as before.

original: padma rnam par dag ni 'dir 'dod chags te /
analyzed: padma rnam par dag ni 'dir 'dod chags te /
translated: Padma is passion here.

original: de nyid ni rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as before, beginning with that itself is the family.

original: sems can gyi don la so sor rtog cing gzigs pas na 'jig rten de la 'byung 'jug tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la so sor rtog cing gzigs pas na 'jig rten de la 'byung 'jug tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Since he observes and sees the welfare of sentient beings, he is the one who has arisen and entered the world.

original: de nyid ni rig pa'i bdag po chen po ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rig pa'i bdag po chen po ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: That itself is the great lord of knowledge, Amitābha.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'o //
translated: That itself is the application to the great seal.

original: de nyid ni thabs kyi mchog ste snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni thabs kyi mchog ste snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: That itself is the supreme method, as before.

original: dmar po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: dmar po ni rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: Red is all aspects.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The left face is white.

original: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: The right face is black.

original: de nyid kyis na a'a ro lika / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na a'a ro lika / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the verse beginning with “Ārolik.”

original: phrag dog la spyod pa rnams la de rnam par dag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrag dog la spyod pa rnams la de rnam par dag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the method of purifying jealousy for those who engage in jealousy,

original: dam tshig ni snying rje chen pos bskyed pa'i phrag dog gis dgug pa mdzad nas nyams su blangs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dam tshig ni snying rje chen pos bskyed pa'i phrag dog gis dgug pa mdzad nas nyams su blangs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The pledge is the essence of practice, having been summoned by the jealousy generated by great compassion.

original: de nyid ni rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: That very one is the family, etc., is as explained above.

original: ljang gu ni rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ljang gu ni rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: Green is all aspects.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The left face is white.

original: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: The right face is black.

original: de nyid kyis na pradzny'a dhrik / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na pradzny'a dhrik / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the verse beginning Prajñādhṛk is stated.

original: ral pa thor tshugs 'chang ba'i lha //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad @170a * //
analyzed: ral pa thor tshugs 'chang ba'i lha // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad @170a * //
translated: The god who wears matted locks,

original: pa'i gzhung bstan pas /🔽ral pa cod pan mdzes dang sna tshogs pa'i //
analyzed: pa'i gzhung bstan pas / ral pa cod pan mdzes dang sna tshogs pa'i //
translated: etc., is explained by the text to be explained below.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of matted locks, beautiful crown, variety, etc., is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to the Tathāgatas as appropriate.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i dbye ba rnam par dag pa las rigs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i dbye ba rnam par dag pa las rigs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the divisions of the families from the divisions of the thoroughly pure,

original: zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems 'di ni 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems 'di ni 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: he says “hatred” and so forth. This mind endowed with desire, hatred, and delusion is called “passionate.”

original: de rnam par dag pas grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas grol ba yin te /
translated: It is liberated by its purity.

original: de'i bdag nyid can yig mi gnas pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can yig mi gnas pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the non-abiding nature of that.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: rigs lnga po 'di dag ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: rigs lnga po 'di dag ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: These five families are of the nature of wisdom and method.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bsgoms par gyur na /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bsgoms par gyur na /
translated: If one meditates with a mind endowed with passion and so forth, the equality of all phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: one will perfect the fruits of buddhahood and so forth.

original: da ni lha mo rnams kyi gdon pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni lha mo rnams kyi gdon pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the verses of the goddesses, he says “then” and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni rdo rje 'dzin pa mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni rdo rje 'dzin pa mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The nature of all the Tathagatas is Vajra Holder Akshobhya.

original: de nyid ni m'a ma k'i la rjes su mnyes pas mnyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni m'a ma k'i la rjes su mnyes pas mnyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “pleasing” because he pleases Mamaki.

original: de nyid ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig ste ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig ste ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
translated: He is called “pledge” because he is not to be transgressed, and “contemplation” because he is absorbed in contemplation.

original: rdo rje 'dzin thams cad ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin thams cad ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: All Vajra Holders are Akshobhya.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog gi rgyur gyur pa'i btsun mo'i mchog ni m'a ma k'i ste de phyung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog gi rgyur gyur pa'i btsun mo'i mchog ni m'a ma k'i ste de phyung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The supreme queen who is the cause of his supreme perfection is Mamaki, and he brought her forth.

original: mi bskyod pa rjes su mnyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung bas na mi bskyod pa'i rigs dang 'brel ba ni m'a ma k'i ste rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta bu ni gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa rjes su mnyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung bas na mi bskyod pa'i rigs dang 'brel ba ni m'a ma k'i ste rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta bu ni gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Mamaki is connected with the family of Akshobhya because she arises from the contemplation of pleasing Akshobhya. This kind of family arrangement should be applied to the others as well.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi bdag nyid can m'a ma k'i phyung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi bdag nyid can m'a ma k'i phyung ba'o //
translated: “These” refers to Mamaki, who is the nature of the mantra.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The phrase that very and so on is as before.

original: shar phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni padma'i nang na mtshams gang du m'a ma k'i bzhugs pa de nyid mtshams su bzhugs pa ste de yang bden bral gyi mtshams nyid yin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni padma'i nang na mtshams gang du m'a ma k'i bzhugs pa de nyid mtshams su bzhugs pa ste de yang bden bral gyi mtshams nyid yin no //
translated: In the eastern corner means that she resides in the very corner where Māmakī resides in the lotus. That is to say, she resides in the very corner of the south-east.

original: la las lho phyogs kyi mtshams su zhes smos pa ni go sla ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: la las lho phyogs kyi mtshams su zhes smos pa ni go sla ba nyid yin te /
translated: Some say in the southern corner is easier to understand.

original: de nyid kyis na bden bral mtshams su bsam zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bden bral mtshams su bsam zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: That is why it says imagine in the corner of the south-east.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de de ni spyan la rjes @170b su mnyes par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de de ni spyan la rjes @170b su mnyes par byed pa yin te /
translated: All the Tathāgatas are Vairocana, and he is delighted by Locanā.

original: de nyid mi phyed par gang du gyur pa'i me long lta bu de nyid la ting nge 'dzin du mdzad pa ste bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed par gang du gyur pa'i me long lta bu de nyid la ting nge 'dzin du mdzad pa ste bshad zin to //
translated: That very mirror-like wisdom, which is undivided, is the very samādhi. This has been explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par sang mdzad de de'i btsun mo'i mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par sang mdzad de de'i btsun mo'i mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the pure ones.

original: lho phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni me'i mtshams so //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni me'i mtshams so //
translated: In the southern corner means in the southeast.

original: de nyid kyis na mo ha ra ti zhes pas lha mo spyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mo ha ra ti zhes pas lha mo spyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: By that very [mantra] is meant the goddess Locana, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'dzin pa rjes su mnyes par byed pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'dzin pa rjes su mnyes par byed pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o /
translated: The one called Vajra-pleasing-holder-of-the-passion-of-all-Tathagatas is Amitabha.

original: nub phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni rlung gi mtshams su'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni rlung gi mtshams su'o //
translated: In the western corner means in the northwest.

original: de nyid kyis na r'a ga ra ti zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na r'a ga ra ti zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: By that very [mantra] is meant the goddess Mamaki, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa ni gdon mi za bar grub pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa ni gdon mi za bar grub pa ste /
translated: The one called Vajra-accomplisher-of-all-the-works-of-all-Tathagata-Bodies-Speech-and-Mind is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i sgrol mas rang gi bdag por nang du chud pas bskyed pa'i phrag dog gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bos phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams kyis khyad par du gsal bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang du rdo rje ltar mi phyed par gyur
analyzed: de'i sgrol mas rang gi bdag por nang du chud pas bskyed pa'i phrag dog gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bos phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams kyis khyad par du gsal bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang du rdo rje ltar mi phyed par gyur
translated: The lord of that wheel, by the special clarity of the outer and secret offerings, is the samadhi that becomes indivisible like a vajra.

original: pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He enters into that.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin snga ma rnams la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin snga ma rnams la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply to the previous samadhis as appropriate.

original: yang na gang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi slu ba ni dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi slu ba ni dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Or else, the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas are the undeceiving.

original: yang na gang dag nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don bya'i gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rnam pa thams cad du bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang dag nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don bya'i gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rnam pa thams cad du bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or else, the nature of the wisdom of successful activity in all ways, the nature of the purification of jealousy, thinking, “It is by me alone that the welfare of migrating beings is to be done, not by others.”

original: de nyid ni rdo rje dang 'dra bar gang du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gdon mi za bar grub pa'i bdag nyid can la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje dang 'dra bar gang du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gdon mi za bar grub pa'i bdag nyid can la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That is called the vajra-like samadhi, which is the nature of the inevitable accomplishment of whatever it becomes.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: “Enters into union with it” has been explained.

original: byang phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs su te /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi grvar zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs su te /
translated: “In the northern corner” is in the northeast.

original: badzra tis rab bskul zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: badzra tis rab bskul zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: “Stirred by Vajra Tīkṣṇa” and so forth.

original: lag tu 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lag tu 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: “One should meditate on the wheel in the hand” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'khor lo bzang dang autpala dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa rnams ni phyag mtshan gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i nges pa yin te 'di rnams dang ci @171a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir / 'khor lo bzang dang autpala dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa rnams ni phyag mtshan gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i nges pa yin te 'di rnams dang ci @171a * //
translated: In order to teach the procedure stated in the thirteenth chapter,

original: rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the explanation beginning with “the excellent wheel and the red lotus” is the certainty of the principal hand implement and so forth, which should be applied as appropriate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni btsun mo'i mchog yin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni btsun mo'i mchog yin pa'am /
translated: The supreme queen is all the tathāgatas themselves.

original: de rnams kyi btsun mo'i mchog ste de'i bdag nyid can gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi btsun mo'i mchog ste de'i bdag nyid can gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme queen of those is the perfection of the nature of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i mchog nyid du gyur pa'i lha mo 'di rnams kyang mchod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i mchog nyid du gyur pa'i lha mo 'di rnams kyang mchod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that these goddesses, who are the supreme queens of all the Tathagatas, are the lords of the mandala of offering, etc.

original: gang sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: The explanation below is that they are called “bodies” because of the nature of the body, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi gnas kyi sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i btsun mo nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi gnas kyi sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i btsun mo nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the supreme queens of the purification of the site of the mandala, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because of the consequence of the contradiction with the purification.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bgegs 'joms par byed pa'i sgo srung gdon pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bgegs 'joms par byed pa'i sgo srung gdon pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Then, the statement beginning with “Then, the Lord of Wrath, etc.” teaches the placement of the door-guardians who conquer the obstructors.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: All the Tathagatas are Vairochana, and his mandala is the body mandala.

original: de byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa'i las kyis byang chub bskyed pa la chags par gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa'i las kyis byang chub bskyed pa la chags par gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The consecration of that is the generation of enlightenment by the rite of summoning. He who does that is called he who is attached to that.

original: khro bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: khro bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The wrathful one, etc., is easy to understand.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos rtogs par bya ba'i tshul rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / gcig pa la sogs pa dang bral bar dran pa de la nye bar 'jog cing /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos rtogs par bya ba'i tshul rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / gcig pa la sogs pa dang bral bar dran pa de la nye bar 'jog cing /
translated: The various ways of realizing the dharmas of body, speech, and mind, free from oneness, etc., are the mindfulness that is placed in them.

original: de rnams la dad pa rnam par dag pa brten pa po'i tshul ni gshin rje mthar byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la dad pa rnam par dag pa brten pa po'i tshul ni gshin rje mthar byed ces bya'o //
translated: The way of relying on the pure faith in them is called Yāma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: All the tathāgatas are Vairocana.

original: de nyid ni le lo can gyi gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang gis bsnyems par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni le lo can gyi gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang gis bsnyems par bya'o //
translated: Just that is the arrogance for the sake of taming the sentient beings to be tamed who are lazy.

original: des na shar phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na shar phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, in the eastern door means

original: sku gsung thugs kyi chos rnams la //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi chos rnams la //
translated: In the dharmas of body, speech, and mind,

original: gcig dang du ma sogs bral ba /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma sogs bral ba /
translated: Free from one, many, etc.,🔽 Is the mindfulness that is placed in them.

original: de dran der ni dad pa gang //
analyzed: de dran der ni dad pa gang //
translated: What is faith in them?

original: shar gyi sgor ni rtogs byar 'dod //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor ni rtogs byar 'dod //
translated: At the eastern gate, he is known as the Realizer.

original: ces bya'o // de nyid kyis na ya m'anta krita ces bya gshin rje gshed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de nyid kyis na ya m'anta krita ces bya gshin rje gshed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smras pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is called Yamântaka, and the two verses beginning with “Destroyer” are spoken.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
translated: The manifest enlightenment of all the Tathagatas is the gnosis of the Dharma Realm.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of its abiding in its own essence is the samadhi of the Tathagata Akshobhya.

original: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang gi rigs kyi bdag po ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang gi rigs kyi bdag po ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the lord of the clan of all the Tathagatas is Akshobhya.

original: de'i ting nge 'dzin @171b gang du ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi bskyod pa lta bu de nyid la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ting nge 'dzin @171b gang du ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi bskyod pa lta bu de nyid la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He enters into the samadhi that is like the manifest perfect enlightenment of Akshobhya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: All the Tathagatas are Akshobhya.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: His mandala is the mind mandala.

original: de byin gyis rlob pa ni 'jug pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: de byin gyis rlob pa ni 'jug pa'i las kyis so //
translated: Its consecration is by the activity of entry.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra'o ;
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra'o ;
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: / dngos po phyung ba'i phyin ci log gi bag chags bcom pa dang mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang ma byung ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bag chags bskyed pa dang gnas par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grub rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: / dngos po phyung ba'i phyin ci log gi bag chags bcom pa dang mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang ma byung ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bag chags bskyed pa dang gnas par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grub rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of striving: to destroy the latent propensities of error that have been brought out, and to prevent their arising; to generate the latent propensities of reality that have not yet arisen, and to make them endure.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la spel ba dang sba bar spro bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams la spel ba dang sba bar spro bar bya'o ;
translated: One should strive to increase and to conceal virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: / de rnam par dag pa brten pa po'i ngo bo ste shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: / de rnam par dag pa brten pa po'i ngo bo ste shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: The essence of the support of its purification is wisdom, which is the final agent.

original: rdo rje dam tshig ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The vajra commitment is Akshobhya.

original: de nyid ni snga ma bzhin bsnyems pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni snga ma bzhin bsnyems pa byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who acts arrogantly, as before.

original: des na lho phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba ni byung dang 'byung 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson 'grus bzhi bshad pa'i rten du gyur pa ni lho phyogs kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: des na lho phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba ni byung dang 'byung 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson 'grus bzhi bshad pa'i rten du gyur pa ni lho phyogs kyi sgo ste /
translated: Therefore, the southern gate is the support for the explanation of the four kinds of striving, which are called “arisen” and “to arise,” and so forth.

original: thar pa'i sgor 'jug par nges pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar pa'i sgor 'jug par nges pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of he is called the one who definitely enters the door of liberation is as follows.

original: de bas na pradznhy'anta krita ces bya ba bla med 'od ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na pradznhy'anta krita ces bya ba bla med 'od ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is called Prajñāhākinīkṛta means he is called Anuttara-prabha and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos ni rdo rje chos so //
translated: All tathāgatas are Akṣobhya and so on, and the dharma that is their essence is Vajradharma.

original: de nyid ni rin po che ste mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la 'od dpag tu med pa lta bur snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rin po che ste mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la 'od dpag tu med pa lta bur snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That very [Vajradharma] is a jewel, and the samādhi that is the source of qualities such as the superknowledges is the one in which he is absorbed, like Amitābha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'chang ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'chang ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The bearer of the desire of all tathāgatas is Amitābha.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: His maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of speech.

original: de'i byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa dang gzhug pas sems can gyi khams rnams kyang rang gi gnas nas mi 'gro bar mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'ching ba'i las can gyi ste lhag ma rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa dang gzhug pas sems can gyi khams rnams kyang rang gi gnas nas mi 'gro bar mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'ching ba'i las can gyi ste lhag ma rnams ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Its function is to bind, because it causes the realms of sentient beings to engage in their abodes through attachment, by summoning and directing them. The rest is as before.

original: phung po lnga po la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i dbye ba dang bral ba'i tshig ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
analyzed: phung po lnga po la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i dbye ba dang bral ba'i tshig ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
translated: Since the five aggregates are the nature of non-self, free from the division of the capacity of grasped and grasper,

original: 'dun pa dang spro ba la gnas pa'i blo gros ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkyang pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang spro ba la gnas pa'i blo gros ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkyang pa ste /
translated: the intelligence that abides in aspiration and enthusiasm is the basis of supernatural power.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: The perfection of qualities such as supernormal knowledge is supernatural power.

original: de'i rkyang ba ni rgyu rnams so //🔽de @172a * //
analyzed: de'i rkyang ba ni rgyu rnams so // de @172a * //
translated: The basis of that is the causes.🔽Those are the four bases of supernatural power.

original: rnams la 'dun pa la sogs pas dmigs par byed pa la mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dran pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la nye bar gnas shing /
analyzed: rnams la 'dun pa la sogs pas dmigs par byed pa la mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dran pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la nye bar gnas shing /
translated: The intelligence that abides in aspiration and so on observes those. Mindfulness, which has the characteristic of non-forgetting, and the exertion of effort abide in that.

original: dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po la kun du spyod pas 'dun pa med pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po la kun du spyod pas 'dun pa med pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro//
translated: The remedy for forgetting the object of meditation is the practice of aspiration, etc.

original: de yang dran pa dang 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi chos bkag pas bslang ba'i brten pa po'i ngo bo ni padma ste /
analyzed: de yang dran pa dang 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi chos bkag pas bslang ba'i brten pa po'i ngo bo ni padma ste /
translated: The lotus is the support of the mind that is aroused by the negation of the objects of memory, aspiration, etc.

original: de nyid ni 'dun pa med pa la sogs pa mthar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dun pa med pa la sogs pa mthar byed pa yin no //
translated: That is the end of aspiration, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni 'dod pa dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni 'dod pa dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The speech of all the Tathagatas is the immeasurable desire.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du nub phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yul la dran pa'i rten du gyur pa ni nub kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du nub phyogs kyi sgor zhes bya ba 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yul la dran pa'i rten du gyur pa ni nub kyi sgo yin te /
translated: In that way, the western door is the support of memory of the objects of aspiration, etc.

original: der zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “there” is the western door.

original: de bas na pad m'anta krita ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na pad m'anta krita ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the two verses beginning with “Padmantaka-kṛta” are stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the body, speech, and mind, which is the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la mi bskyod pa lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la mi bskyod pa lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: That very one, whatever undivided meditative concentration there is, is entered into equipoise like Akṣhobhya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: All the tathāgatas are Vairochana and so forth, and their maṇḍalas of body and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing bas le lo la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la dga' ba'i bya bas byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyis rlob pa ni dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing bas le lo la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la dga' ba'i bya bas byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: Their blessing is the activity of delight for the realms of sentient beings who are attached to laziness through summoning, entering, and binding.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sngar bshad pa'i dngos po rnams la ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rab tu dang ba la spro bas dmigs shing brjed pa med pas yongs su bskor ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mngon sum du
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sngar bshad pa'i dngos po rnams la ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rab tu dang ba la spro bas dmigs shing brjed pa med pas yongs su bskor ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mngon sum du
translated: In the previously explained things without discursive thought, the characteristic of one-pointed mind in meditative concentration, the delight of the mind, is focused with enthusiasm and is not forgotten, and the phenomena that are completely surrounded are directly perceived by the discernment of phenomena.

analyzed: byed pa'i stobs rnams dang ldan pa'i brten pa po'i //
translated: The power of the agent is the power of the support.🔽

analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa'i bgegs rnams mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed do //

translated: The northern gate is the door which is the basis for the samadhi of the powerful destroyer of the obstacles of lack of faith, etc.

original: der bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he dwells there.🔽Therefore, he is called Vighnantakriti, etc.🔽Vairocana is the chief mind, Amitabha is the chief speech,🔽and Akshobhya is the chief body.

translated: and Akshobhya, chief of body,🔽are the three bodies of the one Buddha,🔽the three secrets of all Tathagatas.”🔽The verse beginning with the words, “Vairocana, chief of mind, Amitabha, chief of speech,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni dbang bskur bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni dbang bskur bshad pa yin no //
translated: and Akshobhya, chief of body,🔽are the three bodies of the one Buddha,🔽the three secrets of all Tathagatas.”🔽The verse beginning with the words, “Vairocana, chief of mind, Amitabha, chief of speech,🔽and Akshobhya, chief of body,

original: rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i nges pa yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa'i nges pa yang /
translated: are the three bodies of the one Buddha,🔽the three secrets of all Tathagatas.”🔽The verse beginning with the words, “Vairocana, chief of mind, Amitabha, chief of speech,

analyzed: bri ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rjes su 'brangs nas khro bo rnams la ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and Akshobhya, chief of body,🔽are the three bodies of the one Buddha,🔽the three secrets of all Tathagatas.”

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of the principal body of all the Tathagatas is the body mandala.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The speech mandala and the mind mandala should be understood in the same way.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor de rnams mnyes par byed pa'i phyir thun mong gi dam tshig sems dpa' ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: The common pledge being who pleases those mandalas is Yamantaka.
