translated: In order to take care of jealous persons,

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the pure practice of sexual misconduct is taught, beginning with “Then, the lotus wheel. ”

original: padma'i dkyil 'khor ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: padma'i dkyil 'khor ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The lotus wheel is the wheel of the lotus family.

original: bud med lta bur yang dag par sbyor ba khams gsum na gnas pa thams cad bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bud med lta bur yang dag par sbyor ba khams gsum na gnas pa thams cad bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on all those who live in the three realms as being in union with a consort, like a woman.

original: dam tshig bzhi yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dam tshig bzhi yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the practice of the four commitments,

original: zhes bya ba ni dus bzhi'i sbyor ba'am phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor ba dang / dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor bas bud med de dag thams cad nye bar spyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus bzhi'i sbyor ba'am phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor ba dang / dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor bas bud med de dag thams cad nye bar spyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: means that one should enjoy all those women by the practice of the four times, or the practice of the four seals, or the practice of the two organs.

original: gal te byang chub kyi sems la dmigs nas bud med 'ga' zhig rjes su chags par 'gyur na de'i tshe 'di la yang rnam par dag pa 'di nyid kyis des nye bar longs spod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te byang chub kyi sems la dmigs nas bud med 'ga' zhig rjes su chags par 'gyur na de'i tshe 'di la yang rnam par dag pa 'di nyid kyis des nye bar longs spod par bya'o //
translated: If, while focusing on the thought of awakening, one should become attached to some woman, then at that time, by this very purification, one should enjoy her.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi dam tshig ste sbyor ba gzhan dag la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi dam tshig ste sbyor ba gzhan dag la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the pledge of the family of passion; it should be understood in the other unions as well.

original: de ltar na lus kyi las rnam pa gsum rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na lus kyi las rnam pa gsum rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the purification of the three kinds of physical action,

original: brdzun du smra ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the purification of false speech, beginning with “Then, Vajrapāṇi, having bowed to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, said to the Blessed One: ‘Blessed One, how should one who has entered the Vajra Vehicle act in regard to false speech?’”

original: rdo rje thogs med ces bya ba ni gdon mi za bar grub pa ste gzhan dag la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje thogs med ces bya ba ni gdon mi za bar grub pa ste gzhan dag la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Vajrapāṇi is the one who has definitely accomplished the welfare of others.

original: lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan pa'i brdzun du smra ba de nyid ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan pa'i brdzun du smra ba de nyid ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
translated: That false speech endowed with the divine wheel is the vajra word.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa'i lha thams cad kyi gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa'i lha thams cad kyi gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the form of all the deities that illustrate it.

original: nam mkha' gsung zhes bya ba ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi dmigs su med pa'i ye shes so //🔽de nyid @185a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' gsung zhes bya ba ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi dmigs su med pa'i ye shes so // de nyid @185a * //
translated: “Space-speech” is the non-apprehensible intuition which is the nature of speech.

original: kyis ni shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: kyis ni shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: By that very [intuition] it is “very pure.”

original: 'di ni dam tshig dgug pa'i phyir rigs kyi dam tshig de kho na nyid de sbyor ba gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dam tshig dgug pa'i phyir rigs kyi dam tshig de kho na nyid de sbyor ba gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the reality of the pledge of the clan for the purpose of summoning the pledge, and it should be applied to the other unions as well.

original: tshig rtsub mo smra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo smra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The purification of harsh speech, etc. is declared in “Then, etc.”

original: dam tshig ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The pledge is the reality of the sameness of the nature of the mandala which is not to be transgressed.

original: de ltar dkon mchog dpal bdag por rab tu bsgoms la sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes bya ba lha rnams kyi phan tshun rtsub mo'i ngag la sogs pa 'di dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar dkon mchog dpal bdag por rab tu bsgoms la sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes bya ba lha rnams kyi phan tshun rtsub mo'i ngag la sogs pa 'di dag ste /
translated: Thus, having fully contemplated the glorious Three Jewels as the lord, one should utter the harsh speech, etc. of the deities, “all buddhas,” etc.

original: tshig de gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir spro bar bya'o //
translated: Those words are to be uttered for the purpose of benefiting the beings to be trained.

original: sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa 'di dag gis ni stong pa nyid du rtsod pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa 'di dag gis ni stong pa nyid du rtsod pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: The words “and so on” include the argument about emptiness, and so on.

original: des lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bsten nas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bsten nas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of that, having relied on the wheel of gods, one attains unsurpassed intuition.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni ngag gi las rnam bzhi rnam par dag pa gsungs nas sems rnam par dag pa ni lus dang ngag gi las yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni ngag gi las rnam bzhi rnam par dag pa gsungs nas sems rnam par dag pa ni lus dang ngag gi las yin la /
translated: Thus, having taught the fourfold purity of verbal action, the purity of mind is the action of body and speech.

original: sems rnam par dag pa byed pa ni gzhan dag med de /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa byed pa ni gzhan dag med de /
translated: There is no other agent of the purity of mind.

original: de bas na bdag nyid de rnam par dag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid de rnam par dag par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the self that purifies that.

original: sems rnam par dag pa de yang de dang der mang du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa de yang de dang der mang du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And that purity of mind is taught in many places.

original: gnod sems la sogs pa yin gyi mi dge ba rnam pa gsum rnam par dag pa ni 'dir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: gnod sems la sogs pa yin gyi mi dge ba rnam pa gsum rnam par dag pa ni 'dir ma gsungs so //
translated: But the purity of the three kinds of nonvirtue, such as malice, is not taught here.

original: don 'di nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: don 'di nyid kyis ni /
translated: By this very meaning,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba'i don rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba'i don rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos pa yin no //
translated: the four verses beginning with “the aims of beings who are receptive” are stated.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ngo mtshar la sogs pa brjod pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ngo mtshar la sogs pa brjod pa gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the marvelous, etc., is for the sake of causing the understanding of future generations.  Then and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig gi rdo rje ni gdon mi za bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig gi rdo rje ni gdon mi za bar grub pa'o //
translated: The vajra of the commitments of all the Tathagatas is the Accomplishment of the Unconquerable.

original: dpal ni sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ste de la sogs pas bos te /
analyzed: dpal ni sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ste de la sogs pas bos te /
translated: The glorious is the Remover of All Obstacles, and so forth. He is addressed by those names.

original: de nas rdo rje'i tshig 'di smras zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i tshig 'di smras zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Then, he spoke these vajra words is to be supplied.

original: rmad byung chen po zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dis nan du byas nas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad byung chen po zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dis nan du byas nas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great marvel is because of the fact that it is to be known by means of the insistence of this [mantra].

original: dag pa las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i las rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dag pa las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i las rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The pure action is because of the purification of the contradictory actions.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin yang gzung ba la sogs pa spros pa sna tshogs pa de ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni sbyor ba 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin yang gzung ba la sogs pa spros pa sna tshogs pa de ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
translated: The relative is because this yoga, although it is the nondual intuition, is the relative due to the various elaborations of the apprehended, etc.

original: ji skad @185b du sum cu pa las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad @185b du sum cu pa las kyang /
translated: And as the Triṃśikā says:

original: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
translated: The designation of self and phenomena

original: sna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
translated: arises from the various

original: de ni rnam par shes par gyur //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes par gyur //

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: le'u dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: Chapter X

original: // / le'u bcu par de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yang dag par bskul ba bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / le'u bcu par de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yang dag par bskul ba bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the arousing of the mind of enlightenment of all tathāgatas is spoken of:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽gang na mi gnas mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gang na mi gnas mnyam pa nyid //
translated: Then, etc.🔽Where there is no abiding, that is sameness.

original: ces bya ba ni mnyam nyid kyis gang na yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mnyam nyid kyis gang na yang mi gnas pa ste /

original: rten dang brten pa por gyur pas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa med pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa por gyur pas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa med pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that sameness would not exist as the support and the supported.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: The perfection is wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi sngags kyi tshul rdo rje ste rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sngags kyi tshul rdo rje ste rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bu'o //

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: He entered into the meditative concentration like that.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bskul bas de kho na nyid kyi las mdzad pas na rig pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bskul bas de kho na nyid kyi las mdzad pas na rig pa'o //
translated: Since he is urged by means of the peaceful, etc., he is aware because he performs the deeds of reality.

original: de yang ji skad du //
analyzed: de yang ji skad du //
translated: And that is as stated:

original: zhi la sogs pas rab bskul ba'i //
analyzed: zhi la sogs pas rab bskul ba'i //
translated: Urged by the peaceful, etc.,

original: las rnams byed par rig par bshad //
analyzed: las rnams byed par rig par bshad //
translated: he is explained as performing the deeds.

original: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: And that is as stated:🔽The mantra is also all, and the Tathāgatas are the essence of that, and the urging of that is fierce.

original: sngags kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.

original: de rnams kyi snying po kun du bskul ba ni drag pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po kun du bskul ba ni drag pos kyang ngo //
translated: The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.🔽The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.🔽The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.🔽The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.🔽The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.🔽The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sku'i sgo nas rtsom pa'i sngags kyi rnam bar dag ba ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sku'i sgo nas rtsom pa'i sngags kyi rnam bar dag ba ston to //
translated: The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.

original: gsung dang thugs su yang mngon par brjod pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: gsung dang thugs su yang mngon par brjod pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du /
translated: The mantra is the essence of those, and the urging of that is fierce.🔽 The all is the five aggregates, the five elements, the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five gnoses.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad kyi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad kyi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The mantra

original: gsung gi sgo nas kyang sngags rnams par dag pa gsungs pa ni tshig gi lam nges par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsung gi sgo nas kyang sngags rnams par dag pa gsungs pa ni tshig gi lam nges par brjod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Also, in terms of speech, the pure mantra is taught, called “the path of words is expressed.”

original: tshig med cing tshig dang ldan pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: tshig med cing tshig dang ldan pa med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though there are no words and there is no possession of words,

original: tshig gi nye bar dgod pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi nye bar dgod pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is taught by the presentation of words.

original: 'dar zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dar zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The greatness of the mantra is taught by “trembling” and so forth.

original: sngags 'di lha mo dang rdo rje can gyi rnal 'byor pas bzlas na /
analyzed: sngags 'di lha mo dang rdo rje can gyi rnal 'byor pas bzlas na /
translated: If this mantra is recited by the yogin of the goddess and the vajra holder,

original: 'di lta bu yi mthu ni rnyed dang ldan //
analyzed: 'di lta bu yi mthu ni rnyed dang ldan //
translated: one will attain such power.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: da ni rgyal bskyed par byed pa'i yum gyi sku skyed par byed pa'i rgyu zla ba gnyis kyi rjes thogs la //
analyzed: da ni rgyal bskyed par byed pa'i yum gyi sku skyed par byed pa'i rgyu zla ba gnyis kyi rjes thogs la //
translated: Now, following the two moons, the cause of generating the body of the mother who generates the Victor is taught:

original: h'um dang ldan pa'i rdo rje gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: h'um dang ldan pa'i rdo rje gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the vajra endowed with hūṃ, “Then, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajrapani, etc.”

original: dkyil 'khor bkod pa zhes bya ba na sangs rgyas kyi bkod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa @186a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bkod pa zhes bya ba na sangs rgyas kyi bkod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa @186a * //
translated: The array of the mandala is the nature of the array of the Buddha.

original: snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the mandala of Vairocana.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i zla ba'i gdan la zla ba gnyis su yongs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i zla ba'i gdan la zla ba gnyis su yongs su gyur pa /
translated: The his refers to the two moons on the central moon seat, which transform into two moons.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: On top of that is the syllable hūṃ, which transforms.

original: rang gi gzugs su zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i gzugs dang gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs su zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i gzugs dang gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: The his own form refers to the form of the vajra, which is the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, and is made into one.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dpal mchog dang po'i snying po las byung ba //
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i snying po las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from the essence of the Supreme and Glorious First,

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to:

original: dang po'i snying pos mgon bcas bsgoms nas ni //
analyzed: dang po'i snying pos mgon bcas bsgoms nas ni //
translated: Having meditated on the protector with the essence of the First,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: this explains it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i nga rgyal spangs nas de las rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed par gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i nga rgyal spangs nas de las rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed par gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: By of the Buddha and so forth, he clarifies the abandonment of that pride and the generation of Vajradhara from that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga rgyal de ldan mtha' yas sprul pa yin //
analyzed: nga rgyal de ldan mtha' yas sprul pa yin //
translated: Having that pride, he is the emanation of the infinite.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: and so forth explains it.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to generate the mandala,

original: dang po stong nyid byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang po stong nyid byang chub ste //
translated: the common approach is stated in the verse beginning, “First, emptiness is enlightenment,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i thun mong gi bsnyen pa'i don du padma'i nang du dkyil 'khor sprul pa gsungs pa ni rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i thun mong gi bsnyen pa'i don du padma'i nang du dkyil 'khor sprul pa gsungs pa ni rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth. The generation of the mandala within the lotus is stated in the verse beginning with “one’s own mandala,” and so forth.

original: de rang sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sa bon nyid kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor sbrul pa yin gyi lha rnams kyi so so'i sa bon gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sa bon nyid kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor sbrul pa yin gyi lha rnams kyi so so'i sa bon gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: “By one’s own mantra” means that one’s own mandala is generated by the seed of the lord, not by the individual seeds of the deities.

original: tha mi dad par nye bar bzung ba la tha dad par thal bar 'gyur zhing sngags gcig bzlas pas thams cad kyi sngags bzlas par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par nye bar bzung ba la tha dad par thal bar 'gyur zhing sngags gcig bzlas pas thams cad kyi sngags bzlas par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to take them as non-different, it would follow that they are different, and the fault would follow that by reciting one mantra, all mantras would be recited.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rang gi snying po las byung ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: rang gi snying po las byung ma lus pa'i //
translated: From one’s essence, all

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor pa yi gzugs bsams la //
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor pa yi gzugs bsams la //
translated: The forms of one’s mandala are imagined.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: da ni bshad ma thag pa'i drag po'i bskul ba dang 'brel ba'i don ston cing mngon par rtogs pa yang gsungs pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni bshad ma thag pa'i drag po'i bskul ba dang 'brel ba'i don ston cing mngon par rtogs pa yang gsungs pa ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the previously mentioned intense urging is taught, and the clear realization is also taught.

original: rang sngags skyes bu zhes bya ba ni rang gis bon gyis bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu bsams la /
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu zhes bya ba ni rang gis bon gyis bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu bsams la /
translated: The “person born from one’s mantra” is the person who is imagined to have one’s own seed as his nature.

original: gnas bzhi rnams su zhes gsungs pa ni lha mo'i lte ba dang / dbu dang / lkog ma dang / nu ma gnyis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas bzhi rnams su zhes gsungs pa ni lha mo'i lte ba dang / dbu dang / lkog ma dang / nu ma gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: The “four places” are the navel of the goddess, her head, her throat, and the space between her two breasts.

original: gzugs kyi tshul zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshul zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “form mode” is Vajradhara, etc.

original: zhal gsum lta bu'i sbyor bas kha dog gsum du rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum lta bu'i sbyor bas kha dog gsum du rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the three colors by the method of the three faces.

original: 'di dag gis ni phyag rgya bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni phyag rgya bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By these [verses], the four seals are taught.

original: snying ga'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi mtshan ma'i dbus su chud @186b pa'o ;
analyzed: snying ga'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi mtshan ma'i dbus su chud @186b pa'o ;
translated: “In the middle of the heart” means in the middle of one’s own sign.

original: / phra mo'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni zhes bya ba sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ye shes sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: / phra mo'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni zhes bya ba sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ye shes sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du bsam pa'o //
translated: The subtle maṇḍalas are the maṇḍalas of the jñānasattvas of vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de ni ji skad du /
translated: This is as stated:

original: rang snying zla ba'i rdo rje lte ba'i dbus na yi ge h'um //
analyzed: rang snying zla ba'i rdo rje lte ba'i dbus na yi ge h'um //
translated: “In the center of the vajra hub of the moon in my heart is the syllable hūṃ.🔽”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i'o //
translated: “Its” refers to the sign.

original: dbus su bas ma par bya ba ni rang rang gis bon gyi yi ge ste thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i tshig bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su bas ma par bya ba ni rang rang gis bon gyi yi ge ste thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i tshig bsam par bya'o //
translated: “In the center” means in the center of the sign. “Should be visualized” means that the seed syllables of each should be visualized as the supreme of all.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma phra mo bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rdo rje chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma phra mo bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rdo rje chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach the subtle sign that arises from the transformation of the corresponding seed syllable, [the Bhagavān] declares the great vajra, and so on.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams bzhir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams bzhir ro //
translated: “Always” means in the four periods of the day.

original: sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: “By means of union” means by means of the union of the three meditative stabilizations.

original: de las byung ba'i sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine the three vajras of body, etc. , which arise from that.

original: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //
translated: By the distinction of the vajra hook,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gzugs can dgug pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu rdo rje'i dbye ba ste lcags kyu des lha rnams kyi snying gar dgug pa'i phyir btab par bya ba'am lha rnams nyid rab tu bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gzugs can dgug pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu rdo rje'i dbye ba ste lcags kyu des lha rnams kyi snying gar dgug pa'i phyir btab par bya ba'am lha rnams nyid rab tu bskul bar bya'o //
translated: the vajra hook is the form of light rays, the hook of summoning. By that hook, one should summon the deities to the heart, or one should incite the deities themselves.

original: don 'di nyid rab tu bsgre ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don 'di nyid rab tu bsgre ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to illustrate just this meaning, he says vajra, etc.

original: rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: The nature of vajra is the lotus family.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni 'khor lo'i rigs te 'di dag kyang rdo rje'i bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni 'khor lo'i rigs te 'di dag kyang rdo rje'i bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: The word etc. refers to the wheel family. These are also of the nature of vajra.

original: rang rang gi mtshan ma lcags kyu dang snying gar bskul bas dgug pa'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi mtshan ma lcags kyu dang snying gar bskul bas dgug pa'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the hook, the sign of each, in the heart, in order to summon.

original: rol mo las byung ba zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba ni rol mo ste 'di las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rol mo las byung ba zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba ni rol mo ste 'di las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of arisen from music is that the performance of the aims of sentient beings, such as universal vision, is music, and it is the meaning of arisen from that.

original: zhag bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni theg pa'i che ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: zhag bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni theg pa'i che ba nyid ston to //
translated: Seven days and so forth teach the greatness of the vehicle.

original: don ni 'di yin te dam tshig gsum gyi rnal 'byor pa bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge lnga'i sngags zlos pa dpal ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags la sogs pa 'dis bskul na /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te dam tshig gsum gyi rnal 'byor pa bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge lnga'i sngags zlos pa dpal ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags la sogs pa 'dis bskul na /
translated: The meaning is this: the yogī of the three commitments, reciting the mantra of the five syllables just explained, by this verse beginning Glorious Vajra and the mantra and so forth,

original: dam tshigs las 'das pa'i 'jigs pas sangs rgyas rnams gzigs pa mdzad pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshigs las 'das pa'i 'jigs pas sangs rgyas rnams gzigs pa mdzad pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: the buddhas, fearing transgression of the commitments, will look upon him.

original: de ltar bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify just that which was explained,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sngags kyi skyes bu ni lha rnams so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sngags kyi skyes bu ni lha rnams so //
translated: it is said then and so forth. The mantra beings are the deities.

original: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The three vajras are the vajras of body and so forth.

original: ye shes ni ye shes sems dpa' ste des rdzogs pa'o //🔽dbang po gnyis kyi @187a * //
analyzed: ye shes ni ye shes sems dpa' ste des rdzogs pa'o // dbang po gnyis kyi @187a * //
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom being, and is perfected by that.

original: sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union of the two organs,

original: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can du blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should view the union of method and wisdom.

original: 'di dag kyang mchog gi bsnyen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang mchog gi bsnyen pa nyid yin no //
translated: These are also the supreme service.

original: dngos grub phra mo dag la yang gcig dang gnyis dang gsum rdzogs par bya ste gcig pu ni snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin pa dag kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub phra mo dag la yang gcig dang gnyis dang gsum rdzogs par bya ste gcig pu ni snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin pa dag kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that even in the case of minor powers, one should complete one, two, or three, and that one should meditate on those who are not in union.

original: rig ma'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rang snang ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: rig ma'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rang snang ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The lord of knowledge consorts is the wisdom that is one's own appearance.

original: zhugs pa la zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa la zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the union is the meditation.

original: rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni rdo rje dang padma ste yang dag par sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni rdo rje dang padma ste yang dag par sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The vajra union is the vajra and lotus, and one should meditate on the perfect union.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga'i tshogs dmigs nas tha mi dad par bsgom par bya zhing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bud med ji snyed yod pa de thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor bas nye bar spyad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga'i tshogs dmigs nas tha mi dad par bsgom par bya zhing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bud med ji snyed yod pa de thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor bas nye bar spyad par bya ba ste /
translated: This is the assembly of the five clans, and having visualized them, one should meditate on them as non-different, and should enjoy all the women in all the world-realms by means of the application of the Great Seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni sku mdog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni sku mdog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The Great Seal is the nature of color and shape.

original: sogs pa'i sgras mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya bzhi la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya bzhi la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word etc. should be understood to include the symbolic seal and the four seals.

original: le'u bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the tenth chapter.

original: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Now, from Then and so forth, the eleventh chapter is begun.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni sngags yin pas de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje dang de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags sku la sogs pa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid ni sngags yin pas de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje dang de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags sku la sogs pa'i sa bon te /
translated: Since all the Tathagatas themselves are the mantra, the vajra which is of their nature, and the seed of their body and so forth which is of the nature of the mantra,

original: de las byung ba'i rig pa'i skyes bu ste de ston par byed pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa 'di gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rig pa'i skyes bu ste de ston par byed pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa 'di gsungs pa'o //
translated: The eleventh chapter is taught in order to show the person of awareness that arises from that.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi yi ge ni aom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi yi ge ni aom la sogs pa'o //
translated: The syllable of the three vajras is om and so forth.

original: de nyid ni sngags kyi mchog ste des phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lha rnam par bsgom par bya zhing bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngags kyi mchog ste des phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lha rnam par bsgom par bya zhing bskyed par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the supreme mantra, by which the great seal, which is the desired deity, should be visualized, should be generated.

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni zla ba zhu ba la glu yis bskul ba la sogs pa gzhan dag tu gsungs pa 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni zla ba zhu ba la glu yis bskul ba la sogs pa gzhan dag tu gsungs pa 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The knowledge vajra is the melting moon, which is urged by song and so forth, which is taught elsewhere, and which should be applied here.

original: de nyid aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba'i sems nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba'i sems nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the mind of om, ah, hum, and so forth.

original: de dag ni srid pa bar ma do'i sems kyi dbang nyid kyi sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor gsungs pa ni aom ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge h'um ni thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang phan
analyzed: de dag ni srid pa bar ma do'i sems kyi dbang nyid kyi sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor gsungs pa ni aom ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge h'um ni thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang phan
translated: The statement that those are the essence of the purification of the vajra body, etc., by the power of the mind of the intermediate state of existence is the syllable oṃ, etc.

original: tshun tha dad pa dang bral pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sku gsung thugs yin pas te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshun tha dad pa dang bral pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sku gsung thugs yin pas te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Although the syllable hūṃ is the essence of mind-vajra, it is the body, speech, and mind because it is the essence free from mutual difference.

original: 'khor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzhal yas khang gi sa bon zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge bhr'um bshad @187b pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzhal yas khang gi sa bon zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge bhr'um bshad @187b pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the seed syllable of the celestial mansion, which is the moon located in the stage of the wheel, etc., he says “mandala,” etc.

original: rdo rje kun las skyes zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje rtse gsum pa kha bzhi pa sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje kun las skyes zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje rtse gsum pa kha bzhi pa sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'o //
translated: “Born from all vajras” is the four-faced, three-pronged vajra cross located in the variegated lotus.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: ji skad du dbus gnas pa //
translated: In the center,

original: padma der ni sna tshogs rdo rjes mdzes //
analyzed: padma der ni sna tshogs rdo rjes mdzes //
translated: the lotus is beautified by the variegated vajra cross.

original: zhes smos pa yin te der skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin te der skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: This is the meaning of “born there.”

original: / sngags kyi bzlas brjod dang 'brel pa'i yi ge gsum po gdan dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / sngags kyi bzlas brjod dang 'brel pa'i yi ge gsum po gdan dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three syllables related to mantra recitation and seat are stated in the vajra maṇḍala, etc.🔽The vajra and clear phenomena maṇḍalas

original: rdo rje dang gsal ba'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang gsal ba'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor rnams te /
translated: are the moon maṇḍalas.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de dag la gnas pa ni yi ge aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba spro ba bsgom zhing bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de dag la gnas pa ni yi ge aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba spro ba bsgom zhing bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Abiding in those, one should meditate on the emanation and recitation of the syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: lhag ma ye shes sems dpa'i dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ye shes sems dpa'i dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: The rest abide in the maṇḍala of the great empowerment of the gnosis being.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang / rdo rje gsal chos 'khor lo de //
analyzed: de yang / rdo rje gsal chos 'khor lo de //
translated: the maṇḍala of the clear phenomena of the vajra

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer chud //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer chud //
translated: is included in the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: gnas der brtan par byas nas ni //
analyzed: gnas der brtan par byas nas ni //
translated: Having stabilized it in that place,

original: ye shes sku ni spros shing bzlas brjod bya //
analyzed: ye shes sku ni spros shing bzlas brjod bya //
translated: the gnosis body is emanated and the recitation is performed.

original: zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained.

original: yang na rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor nyid ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pas na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor nyid ni mi phyed pa nyid yin pas na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Or else, the mandala of Vairocana is the vajra mandala, because it is indivisible.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid ni bems po ma yin pas na gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid ni bems po ma yin pas na gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of Amitābha is the clear mandala, because it is not inanimate.

original: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid ni chos bdag med pa'i ngo po nyid yin pas na chos kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid ni chos bdag med pa'i ngo po nyid yin pas na chos kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The mandala of Akṣobhya is the dharma mandala, because it is the nature of the realitylessness of dharmas.

original: de rnams kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yi ge aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba cho ga bzhin bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yi ge aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba cho ga bzhin bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the syllables OṀ, ĀḤ, and HŪṀ, respectively, in accordance with the procedure, abiding in the wheels of those [three mandalas].

original: gang yang phan tshun dbye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang yang phan tshun dbye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are mutually inseparable, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par //
translated: In the center of the vajra mandala,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: the mandala of Akṣobhya.

original: aom zhes bya ba rab tu bsgom //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba rab tu bsgom //
translated: One should visualize the syllable OṀ.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: The secret mandala is the mandala of Vairocana.

original: yi ge a'a:ni rnam par bsam //
analyzed: yi ge a'a:ni rnam par bsam //
translated: The letter A is imagined as the Dharma.

original: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is the very maṇḍala of Amitābha.

original: h'um gi rnam par bsgom par 'dod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te phan tshun tha mi dad pa yin pa mang du smras zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: h'um gi rnam par bsgom par 'dod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te phan tshun tha mi dad pa yin pa mang du smras zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who wishes to meditate on the form of HŪṀ is not correct, because of the many statements of the non-difference of the two.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge bhv'um yongs su gyur pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge bhv'um yongs su gyur pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma gsungs pa ni /
translated: The palace of the transformation of the just-mentioned letter BHRŪṀ is stated:

original: yi ge bhr'um gyis gnas bsgoms te //🔽zhes bya ba ste 'khor lo la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu @188a * //
analyzed: yi ge bhr'um gyis gnas bsgoms te // zhes bya ba ste 'khor lo la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu @188a * //
translated: Meditate on the abode with the letter BHRŪṀ.

original: brgyud pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brgyud pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the wheel, etc. are one after another.

original: da ni sngar bshad pa'i thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi yi ge gsum po ho zhes bya ba'i dbus su gnas pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni sngar bshad pa'i thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi yi ge gsum po ho zhes bya ba'i dbus su gnas pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the three letters of the nature of the mind explained above, abiding in the middle of the syllable HO, are stated:

original: snying po dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: snying po dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The essence of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: de gang yin zhe na sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bor yi ge gsum po rdo rje 'dzin yab dang yum gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bor yi ge gsum po rdo rje 'dzin yab dang yum gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: What is that? The three syllables in the nature of body, speech, and mind, the nature of the male and female holders of the vajra.

original: mnyes par byed pa ni yi ge ho dmar po gnyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mnyes par byed pa ni yi ge ho dmar po gnyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The pleasing is the two red syllables ho.

original: yang ji skad du /
analyzed: yang ji skad du /
translated: Also, as it is said:

original: 'od ldan ho dang spel ba cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: 'od ldan ho dang spel ba cho ga bzhin //
translated: Endowed with light, enhanced with ho, as prescribed.

original: zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: That is what is said.🔽As for what was said above,

original: gang sngar / rdo rje gsum gyi gnas sgom pa //
analyzed: gang sngar / rdo rje gsum gyi gnas sgom pa //
translated: Meditate on the abode of the three vajras,

original: zhes gsungs pa de'i don gnas ni yi ge gsum gyi mtshan nyid can te sku rdo rje la sogs bskyed pa'i sa bon gsungs pa ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de'i don gnas ni yi ge gsum gyi mtshan nyid can te sku rdo rje la sogs bskyed pa'i sa bon gsungs pa ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the meaning of that is: the abode is characterized by the three syllables, the seed syllables for generating the body vajra and so forth.🔽Om is the body of the buddhas,

original: aom ni sangs rgyas sku'i zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'i'o //
analyzed: aom ni sangs rgyas sku'i zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'i'o //
translated: that is, of the body vajra.

original: mtshag ni bskyed pa'i sa bon bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshag ni bskyed pa'i sa bon bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The seed syllable is meditated as the seed syllable for generation.

original: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la ni yi ge a'a: dang h'um sa bon yin par gsungs pa ni a'a:ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la ni yi ge a'a: dang h'um sa bon yin par gsungs pa ni a'a:ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the seed syllables of the Speech and Mind Vajras are said to be the syllables A and HŪM, as it is said, “A is the seed syllable of the Speech Vajra, and HŪM is the seed syllable of the Mind Vajra.”

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: “ Wisdom” means generated by the yogi.

original: dam tshig ces bya ba ni dam tshig sems dpa' skyed par byed pa'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dam tshig dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba ni dam tshig sems dpa' skyed par byed pa'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dam tshig dang bcas pa ste /
translated: “ Commitment” means the commitment of blessing the eyes, etc., which generate the Commitment Being.

original: rdo rje gsum po 'di dag ni sngags kyi rig pa zhes bya bar bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum po 'di dag ni sngags kyi rig pa zhes bya bar bsgrags pa'o //
translated: These three Vajras are proclaimed as the “mantra knowledge.”

original: dngos grub phra mo'i khyad par las dum bu bstan pa'i phyir dben zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos grub phra mo'i khyad par las dum bu bstan pa'i phyir dben zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the special subtle accomplishments, he says, “In a solitary place,” etc.

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The “clear maṇḍala” is the maṇḍala of the moon.

original: der rang gi sngags kyi dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad de de skyed pa'i cho gas bskyed la /
analyzed: der rang gi sngags kyi dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad de de skyed pa'i cho gas bskyed la /
translated: There, one’s own mantra commitment is Vairocana, generated by the rite of generating him.

original: yi ge aom gcig mtshan ma la gnas pa snying gar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge aom gcig mtshan ma la gnas pa snying gar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place the single syllable OṀ, the sign, at the heart.

original: 'dis ni sku rdo rje dang 'od mnyam par 'gyur gyi sku'i rdo rje yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sku rdo rje dang 'od mnyam par 'gyur gyi sku'i rdo rje yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: By this, one becomes equal to Vajra Body, but not to the complete Vajra Body.

original: sngar yongs su rdzogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rnal 'byor pa gang gi mtshan mas kyang phyis nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyag rgya gcig dang ldan pa'i lha nyid gcig bu snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i cho ga bzhin du
analyzed: sngar yongs su rdzogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rnal 'byor pa gang gi mtshan mas kyang phyis nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyag rgya gcig dang ldan pa'i lha nyid gcig bu snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i cho ga bzhin du
translated: The former is complete, and the yogi of the three samadhis, by the sign, later is not in union with the deity alone, endowed with the single seal, free from the near attainment, etc.

original: bsgoms pa las sku rdo rje brtag pa las ji skad du gsungs pa'i phan yon 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las sku rdo rje brtag pa las ji skad du gsungs pa'i phan yon 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the benefits taught in the Vajra Body chapter are accomplished by meditation according to the rite.

original: de bzhin pa 'di'i 'og ma rnams la @188b yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin pa 'di'i 'og ma rnams la @188b yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied to the following as well.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dngos grub thob pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas ni //
analyzed: dngos grub thob pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas ni //
translated: having seen the sign of attaining power,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smos pa yin no //
translated: and so on, the verse is stated.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa dang mnyam pa'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa dang mnyam pa'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the power equal to Amitābha is the Dharma maṇḍala, etc.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje chos kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje chos kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The Dharma maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of Vajradharma.

original: der sngags kyi skyes bu 'od dpag tu med pa cho ga bzhin du bskyed la de'i ngag gi lam ste /
analyzed: der sngags kyi skyes bu 'od dpag tu med pa cho ga bzhin du bskyed la de'i ngag gi lam ste /
translated: In that, one should generate the mantra being Amitābha according to the rite, and his path of speech,

original: lkog mar padma'i lte ba la gnas pa zla brten pa'i yi ge a'a:cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag go //
analyzed: lkog mar padma'i lte ba la gnas pa zla brten pa'i yi ge a'a:cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag go //
translated: the syllable AḤ located in the center of the lotus at the throat, supported by a moon, should be placed according to the rite.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni mchog ste de bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni mchog ste de bsgom pa'o //
translated: That itself is the supreme nature of the great vajra, Lokeśvara, the nature of discrimination, which is cultivated.

original: de yang 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom pas dgongs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom pas dgongs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that should be understood as cultivated by the cultivation of Amitābha.

original: thugs rdo rje'i rtog pa'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i rtog pa'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the power of the conception of Vajra Mind is the vajra maṇḍala, etc.

original: sems la yi ge h'um gnas pa //
analyzed: sems la yi ge h'um gnas pa //
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is located in the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying gar rdo rje'i lte ba la yi ge h'um cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying gar rdo rje'i lte ba la yi ge h'um cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the syllable hūṃ on the hub of the vajra at one’s heart center, in accordance with the rite.

original: mi snang ba'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni ye shes dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya chen po ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsams la /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni ye shes dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya chen po ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsams la /
translated: The attainment of invisibility is stated with the words “the mandala of wisdom,” etc. One should imagine the great seal of Ākāśagarbha in the center of the mandala of wisdom.

original: de'i gnas bzhir yi ge kham lha mo med pa'i mtshan ma zla ba la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas bzhir yi ge kham lha mo med pa'i mtshan ma zla ba la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In its four places, one should meditate on the seed syllable khaṃ, the sign without a goddess, located on a moon.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni ye shes kyi dam tshig ste nam mkha'i snying po'i rtog par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni ye shes kyi dam tshig ste nam mkha'i snying po'i rtog par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The pledge of the vajra of space is the imagination of Ākāśagarbha.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang sngags skyes bu ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang sngags skyes bu ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal te /
translated: The attainment of Ārya Mañjuśrī is stated with the words “the vajra mandala,” etc. The person born from one’s mantra is Ārya Mañjuśrī.

original: de cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la //
analyzed: de cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la //
translated: One should imagine him in accordance with the rite.

original: de'i snying gar rang gi mtshan ma'i dbus su yi ge h'um zhes bya ba cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snying gar rang gi mtshan ma'i dbus su yi ge h'um zhes bya ba cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, in the center of one’s sign, one should meditate on the syllable hūṃ, according to the rite.

original: chog 'di nyid kyi thlim zhes bya ba yang bsgom par byas nas phan yon ji skad du bshad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chog 'di nyid kyi thlim zhes bya ba yang bsgom par byas nas phan yon ji skad du bshad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having also meditated on the syllable tliīṃ of this very rite, one will obtain the benefits as explained.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan dag gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan dag gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other special samādhis are stated beginning with “the realm of space,” etc.

original: mi bskyod pa rnam par bsams la cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du de'i thugs kar yi ge aom bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa rnam par bsams la cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du de'i thugs kar yi ge aom bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized Akṣobhya, one should visualize the syllable oṃ in his heart, according to the rite.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par gzhan gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par gzhan gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The other special applications are stated beginning with “the realm of space,” etc. “The vajra of space” is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: @189a * // rin chen aom zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yi ge aom ste de cho ga bzhin du bsgoms na ji skad bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @189a * // rin chen aom zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yi ge aom ste de cho ga bzhin du bsgoms na ji skad bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The jewel Om means the Om syllable of the nature of equality. If one meditates on it according to the rite, one will obtain the benefits as explained.

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'jig rten dbang po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag gsungs pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'jig rten dbang po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The other samadhis are taught beginning with “in the realm of space,” etc. The Lord of the World is Amitabha.

original: chos kyi aom ni padmo'i rigs lta bu ste de snying gar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi aom ni padmo'i rigs lta bu ste de snying gar bsam par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma Om is like the lotus family. One should imagine it at the heart.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje autpala ni don yod grub pa ste de bsgoms la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje autpala ni don yod grub pa ste de bsgoms la /
translated: In the realm of space, etc. The vajra utpala is Amoghasiddhi. Having meditated on that,

original: de'i thugs ka'i mtshan mar zla ba la dam tshig aom rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i mtshan mar zla ba la dam tshig aom rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: at the sign of his heart, one should meditate on the pledge Om on a moon.

original: de ltar rigs lnga char la yang yi ge aom gyis sgom pa bstan nas sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum cig car bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs lnga char la yang yi ge aom gyis sgom pa bstan nas sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum cig car bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having taught the meditation on the five families with the syllable oṃ, in order to teach the three bodies of the Buddha, body, speech, and mind, all together, he says “in the realm of space,” and so on.

original: sku gsum aom zhes bya ba ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid de gnas gsum char du yang yi ge aom mtshan ma'i zla ba la gnas pa cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsum aom zhes bya ba ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid de gnas gsum char du yang yi ge aom mtshan ma'i zla ba la gnas pa cho ga bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The three bodies are called oṃ, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, the saṃbhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya. In all three places, one should meditate on the syllable oṃ, abiding on the moon of the sign, in accordance with the rite.

original: gnas gsungs pa ni rnam par dben pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gsungs pa ni rnam par dben pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The place is said to be “in a solitary place,” and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: la lar dri med chu ni phun tshogs shing //
analyzed: la lar dri med chu ni phun tshogs shing //
translated: In some places, the water is pure and abundant,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa rnam pa lnga bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan las byung ba'i las kyi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnam pa lnga bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan las byung ba'i las kyi tshogs gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to accomplish the five kinds of superknowledge, he teaches the collection of the works of concentration:

original: mi bskyod ye shes rdo rje sogs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi bskyod ye shes rdo rje sogs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Akshobhya, jñānavajra, and so on.

original: de la mi bskyod pa cho ga bzhin du bsam la mig dang rna ba dang sems dang yid dang lus te /
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa cho ga bzhin du bsam la mig dang rna ba dang sems dang yid dang lus te /
translated: One should imagine Akṣobhya in accordance with the rite, and the eyes, ears, mind, thought, and body.🔽

original: gnas lngar rang gi sngags kyis rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje lnga bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas lngar rang gi sngags kyis rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje lnga bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize Akṣobhya in accordance with the rite, and the five vajras with five-pronged tips, with one’s own mantra, at the five places, eye, ear, mind, thought, and body.

original: da rnams la yang zla ba la gnas pa'i sngar bshad pa'i yi ge thlim cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la mngon par shes pa lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da rnams la yang zla ba la gnas pa'i sngar bshad pa'i yi ge thlim cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la mngon par shes pa lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should visualize the syllable TLiM, as previously explained, on a moon, in accordance with the rite, at the five places, and one will become like the one with the five superknowledges.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas /
translated: In the same way, the practitioner of Vairocana

original: rang sngags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo gnas lnga'i sbyor bas bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sngags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo gnas lnga'i sbyor bas bsam par bya'o //
translated: should visualize the wheel, which is the transformation of one’s own seed, with the application of one’s own mantra at the five places.

original: sngar bshad pa'i gnas lngar gtogs pa'i 'khor lo lnga la yi ge thlim cho ga bzhin du bsgoms na mngon shes lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i gnas lngar gtogs pa'i 'khor lo lnga la yi ge thlim cho ga bzhin du bsgoms na mngon shes lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should visualize the five wheels belonging to the five places, as previously explained, with the syllable TLiM, in accordance with the rite, and one will become like the one with the five superknowledges.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, one should apply this in the same way to the other signs.

original: yi ge bh'um gyi rjes la 'khor lo la sogs pa khang pa @189b brtsegs ma'i rgyu yin par gsungs pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge bh'um gyi rjes la 'khor lo la sogs pa khang pa @189b brtsegs ma'i rgyu yin par gsungs pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: After the syllable bhrūṃ, the cause of the palace with the wheel, etc., is stated: “the vajra dakini,” etc.

original: sangs rgyas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i sangs rgyas spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi rigs ma dang rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las so //🔽sangs rgyas gnas dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i sangs rgyas spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi rigs ma dang rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las so // sangs rgyas gnas dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: The “entry of the buddhas” is the prior projection of one’s own mother, preceded by the projection of the buddhas urged by the light rays, etc., and the transformation of Vairochana.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rten dang gcig tu gyur pa yin gyi 'dir 'dra ba'i sgra mtshungs pa'i tshig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rten dang gcig tu gyur pa yin gyi 'dir 'dra ba'i sgra mtshungs pa'i tshig ni ma yin te /
translated: “One becomes like the abode of the buddhas” means that one becomes one with the support of the buddhas, but the word “like” is not a word of similarity here.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because this is the result of the perfect application.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la thig le bsgom pa gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la thig le bsgom pa gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the meditation on the drop in the subtle yoga is the passage beginning “The mandala of the Buddha” and so on.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi snying gar yi ge aom cho ga bzhin du bsams la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi snying gar yi ge aom cho ga bzhin du bsams la /
translated: In the subtle yoga of Vairochana, one should imagine the syllable oṃ in the heart, in accordance with the rite.

original: yi ge aom de nyid la sems thig ler gyur pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ste rab tu rgyu ba 'gog par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge aom de nyid la sems thig ler gyur pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ste rab tu rgyu ba 'gog par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on that syllable oṃ as the drop, that is, as the vajra of cessation, the stopping of the movement of the mind.

original: de bzhin du 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang phra mo'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang phra mo'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply the subtle Akshobhya and so on to the following.

original: 'gog pa'i rdo rje ye shes zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i dam tshig gi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rdo rje ye shes zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i dam tshig gi ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the vajra of cessation is the knowledge of the commitment of Akshobhya.

original: 'di dag ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi sgrar mi bshad de spro ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi sgrar mi bshad de spro ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are not explained as the yoga of the drop, because there is no emission and so on.

original: yang dngos grub phra mo la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor ba sngar bshad pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can yi ge aom bsams na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dngos grub phra mo la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor ba sngar bshad pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can yi ge aom bsams na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said that if a practitioner of Vairocana imagines the syllable OṀ, which has the nature of body, speech, and mind as explained above, he will have a long life.

original: rdo rje nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /

translated: One should meditate on Mañjuvajra arisen from the letter ma, who is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: Here also, if one meditates on the letter ha explained previously on all the limbs, then even Brahmā and so on will not be able to see him.

analyzed: spro ba yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi sa bon gyis bya'o //

original: sngags yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma'i ril bus mi snang ba'i dngos grub gsung pa ni rdo rje mi phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
