translated: The statement of the power of invisibility by the pill of the sign that is the transformation of the mantra is the vajra of the three inseparable, etc.🔽The five pledges are the five words arisen from the vajra of the three inseparable.

original: dam tshig lnga ni rdo rje mi phyed pa gsum las byung ba'i tshig lnga gang yin pa de'i ril bu gser dang dngul dang zangs kyis dkris pa /
analyzed: dam tshig lnga ni rdo rje mi phyed pa gsum las byung ba'i tshig lnga gang yin pa de'i ril bu gser dang dngul dang zangs kyis dkris pa /
translated: The pill of those is wrapped in gold, silver, and copper.

original: rang gi sa bon las bskyed pa /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las bskyed pa /
translated: It is generated from one’s seed.

original: tsan ka'i 'bru'i tshad tsam byas la /
analyzed: tsan ka'i 'bru'i tshad tsam byas la /
translated: It is made the size of a mustard seed.

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mi phyed pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa lta bur sems bsgoms la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mi phyed pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa lta bur sems bsgoms la /
translated: Having cultivated the mind like the perfect complete circle of the indivisible mandala of all Buddhas,

original: de nas bar snang las byung ba'i ril bu lngar bskyed nas aom la sogs pa sa bon tsam dang ldan pa'i lha de spyi'i rnal 'byor pa'i zlos pas khar bcug nas bsgoms na ji skad gsungs pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bar snang las byung ba'i ril bu lngar bskyed nas aom la sogs pa sa bon tsam dang ldan pa'i lha de spyi'i rnal 'byor pa'i zlos pas khar bcug nas bsgoms na ji skad gsungs pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then having generated the five pills arisen from space, and having placed the deity endowed with the mere seed syllable OṀ and so on in the mouth with the recitation of the general yogi, if one meditates, one will obtain the benefits as stated.

original: 'dir gang dang gang ma gsungs pa de ni snga ma dang phyi mas kha bskang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang dang gang ma gsungs pa de ni snga ma dang phyi mas kha bskang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, whatever is not stated should be supplemented by the previous and subsequent [statements].

original: 'khor lo'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang gi sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo can gyi lha'i sngags dang / de'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor lo lcags sam sa'am gzhan gang yang rung ba las bskyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dngos grub gsungs pa ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang gi sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo can gyi lha'i sngags dang / de'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor lo lcags sam sa'am gzhan gang yang rung ba las bskyed pa /
translated: The statement of the power of the wheel is “Mañjuvajra” and so on. “ With one’s mantra” means the mantra of the deity with the wheel, and the yogi of that [mantra] generates the wheel from iron, clay, or whatever else is suitable.

original: rang gi bdag po dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rang gi bdag po dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur par bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the abode of all the Buddhas, the perfect complete mandala circle of one’s own lord,

original: sngar bshad pa'i khyad par gyi rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ba cig gis 'khor lo'i dngos grub de lag tu rnam par bsgoms na ji skad du bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i khyad par gyi rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ba cig gis 'khor lo'i dngos grub de lag tu rnam par bsgoms na ji skad du bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: the yogin of the deity who is in accord with the family as previously explained, if he meditates on the power of the wheel in his hand, he will obtain the benefits as explained.

original: /'dir yang gong ma dang 'og ma'i kha bskang pa ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: /'dir yang gong ma dang 'og ma'i kha bskang pa ltos par bya'o //
translated: Here also, the higher and lower should be filled in as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje dang padma dang rang gri la yang bskyed pa la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje dang padma dang rang gri la yang bskyed pa la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should apply the generation, etc. of the vajra, lotus, and one’s own knife as appropriate.

original: rin po che la sogs pa yang rang rang gi sngags las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa yang rang rang gi sngags las grub pa yin no //
translated: The jewel, etc. are also accomplished from their own mantras.

original: sbyor ba'i de'i rjes su 'brangs nas sngar bshad pa'i ril bu rnams kyi rang gi sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i tshad kyi lha'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa 'dra bar sngar ma bshad pa gsungs pa ni aom ni ril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i de'i rjes su 'brangs nas sngar bshad pa'i ril bu rnams kyi rang gi sa bon gyis bskyed pa'i tshad kyi lha'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa 'dra bar sngar ma bshad pa gsungs pa ni aom ni ril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Following that, the previously explained pill-generated deity yoga, etc., which is similar, but not previously explained, is stated: “Oṃ, the pill, etc.”

original: da ni sngar bshad pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa sngar bshad pa'i rim pas bskyed pa'i 'khor lo grub pa rang gi lag @190b par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ma gsungs pa de kha bskang par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngar bshad pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa sngar bshad pa'i rim pas bskyed pa'i 'khor lo grub pa rang gi lag @190b par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ma gsungs pa de kha bskang par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to supplement what was not previously stated, such as “the previously explained deity yoga practitioner should meditate on the previously explained wheel-accomplishment in his own hand,” etc.,

original: mkha' dbyings gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' dbyings gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “the clear sky,” etc.

original: chos 'byung ba'i zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms la sngar bshad pa'i 'khor lo lag pas 'dzin par rab tu bsgoms na ji skad du bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms la sngar bshad pa'i 'khor lo lag pas 'dzin par rab tu bsgoms na ji skad du bshad pa'i phan yon 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Meditating on Vairocana, previously explained, seated on a moon seat in the source of phenomena, holding the previously explained wheel in his hand, one will obtain the benefits as explained.

original: 'khor lo chen po'i rigs zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo'i rigs kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyang 'di bzhin du bsgoms la mtshan ma 'di bskyed cing de 'dzin pa la sogs pas ye shes mchog ste mchog gi ye shes kyi sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po'i rigs zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo'i rigs kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyang 'di bzhin du bsgoms la mtshan ma 'di bskyed cing de 'dzin pa la sogs pas ye shes mchog ste mchog gi ye shes kyi sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The “family of the great wheel” is the deities who have the tantra of the wheel family.

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The “vajra of wisdom” is the yogin.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje la sogs pa la yang gzung bar bya bar gsungs pa ni mkha' dbyings rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thams cad ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje la sogs pa la yang gzung bar bya bar gsungs pa ni mkha' dbyings rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thams cad ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Similarly, the “vajra space” and so forth are said to be held by the vajra and so forth.

original: rtse gsum la sogs pa la yang skyes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni tri sh'u la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gsum la sogs pa la yang skyes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni tri sh'u la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “trident” and so forth are said to be born and so forth.

original: rdo rje khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: “By the distinction of the vajra” means in the manner of being in accordance with the lord.

original: da ni dgug pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje dgug pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dgug pa'o //
analyzed: da ni dgug pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje dgug pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dgug pa'o //
translated: Now, the prescription of the rite of summoning is stated with “the path” and so on. The “vajra-summoner” is the vajra-summoner.

original: sbyor gsum sngags kyi skyes bur bsam //
analyzed: sbyor gsum sngags kyi skyes bur bsam //
translated: One should imagine oneself as the deity born from the mantra-being through the three-consecrations.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku dad gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku dad gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the one endowed with the consecrations of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i lha'i skyes bur bdag nyid bsams la sbyor ba gsum dang ldan pa'i lcags kyu bsgoms te /
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i lha'i skyes bur bdag nyid bsams la sbyor ba gsum dang ldan pa'i lcags kyu bsgoms te /
translated: Having imagined oneself as the deity born from the mantra-being through the three-consecrations, one should meditate on the hook endowed with the three-consecrations.

original: sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo dgug pa'i phyir gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo dgug pa'i phyir gtang bar bya'o //
translated: One should emit it in order to summon the essence of body and so on.

original: dgug par bya ba yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par byas pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis dgug pa'i sbyor ba gang 'dod pa de nyid kyis dgug pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dgug par bya ba yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par byas pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis dgug pa'i sbyor ba gang 'dod pa de nyid kyis dgug pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: The one to be summoned is made to stand on the wind-disk. This is the summoning by the Buddha, and there is no contradiction in summoning by that very one who desires.

original: de lta mod kyi rnam par snang mdzad ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du gsungs pa yin te rnam par snang mdzad gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor lo chen po bsams la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rnam par snang mdzad ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du gsungs pa yin te rnam par snang mdzad gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor lo chen po bsams la /
translated: Nevertheless, Vairocana is stated to be merely the illustrative meaning, and one should imagine the great wheel with Vairocana as the principal figure.

original: dgug pa'i lcags kyu dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba de dag gis gnas bsams nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
analyzed: dgug pa'i lcags kyu dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba de dag gis gnas bsams nas dgug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
translated: Having imagined the abode of those victors endowed with the hook of summoning, one should summon—this is the meaning indicated.

original: lcags kyus dgug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: lcags kyus dgug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there summoning by the hook,

original: gzhan dag gis kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya @191a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya @191a * //
translated: but it is also indicated that there is summoning by others.

original: ba'i phyir rdo rje padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir rdo rje padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To indicate this, he says vajra lotus, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi zhes bya ba ni sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi lcags kyu la sogs pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dgug pa la brtson pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi zhes bya ba ni sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi lcags kyu la sogs pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dgug pa la brtson pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the hooks, etc. , which are of the nature of body, etc. , and one should imagine the wind mandala as striving to summon the one to be summoned.

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i bza' ba'i khyad par rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i bza' ba'i khyad par rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to purify the special food endowed with great power,🔽he mentions the supreme aspect, etc.

original: rnam pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdo rje can gyi sku'i rdo rjer lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: rnam pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdo rje can gyi sku'i rdo rjer lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: Having imagined oneself as Vajradhara, the body of the mandala endowed with the supreme of all aspects, through the power of conviction,

original: lce nyid la 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis rdo rje de'i sbyor bas de nyid du bsgoms na gsung gi rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lce nyid la 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis rdo rje de'i sbyor bas de nyid du bsgoms na gsung gi rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if one meditates on that very tongue as a vajra through the yoga of that vajra, as explained below, one will become like Vajra Speech.🔽And these should be done after the mandala worship and praise of the goddesses of form, etc.

original: 'di dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchod pa dang bstod pa'i rjes thogs la bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni gsang ba gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchod pa dang bstod pa'i rjes thogs la bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni gsang ba gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the three secrets, etc.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje can ni phyag rgya bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa'i mchog rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje can ni phyag rgya bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa'i mchog rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the vajra of body and so forth endowed with the four seals and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares the best of aspects and so forth.

original: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa'i sku'i rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa snying gar ye shes sems dpa' dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa'i sku'i rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa snying gar ye shes sems dpa' dang ldan pa /
translated: The vajra of body and so forth blessed with all the marks, endowed with the gnosis being at the heart,

original: dbu rgyan la rang gi rigs kyi bdag po 'chang ba'i sku rdo rjer bdag nyid rnam par bsgoms la tshim par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbu rgyan la rang gi rigs kyi bdag po 'chang ba'i sku rdo rjer bdag nyid rnam par bsgoms la tshim par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: wearing the lord of one's own family on the crown, one should meditate on oneself as the vajra of body, and be satisfied.

original: lce rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lce'i gnas su zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pas h'um gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te /
analyzed: lce rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni rdo rje'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lce'i gnas su zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pas h'um gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te /
translated: He declares the purity of the tongue: the vajra yoga and so forth. Having imagined a five-pronged vajra blessed by HŪṂ at the site of the tongue, on a moon, from the transformation of the syllable HŪṂ,

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor bas sbyang ba la sogs pa'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor bas sbyang ba la sogs pa'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: one should eat with the rite of purification and so forth with the yoga of the five nectars.

original: des ni rdo rje gsum nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ni rdo rje gsum nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this, one attains the three vajras, means that this is the meaning.

original: spyang ba'i cho ga bstan pa ni yi ge aa las byung ba'i thod pa bsams la yi ge aom steng du bsgoms te /
analyzed: spyang ba'i cho ga bstan pa ni yi ge aa las byung ba'i thod pa bsams la yi ge aom steng du bsgoms te /
translated: The teaching of the rite of purification is that one should imagine a skull born from the letter A, and meditate on the letter Om above it.

original: de'i nang du dam tshig gi bza' par bya ba'i rdzas gzhag par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du dam tshig gi bza' par bya ba'i rdzas gzhag par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should place the substances to be eaten for the pledge in its interior.

original: yi ge h'um yang 'dir bar snang la rdo rje'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang ldan pa thod par gnas par bya'o //

translated: The syllable OṀ of the vajra of intuition

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i nor bu'i char yi ge aom las byung bar shes rab kyi gnas skabs su bsgom par bya ba'i phyir dran par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i nor bu'i char yi ge aom las byung bar shes rab kyi gnas skabs su bsgom par bya ba'i phyir dran par bya'o //
translated: is to be remembered in order to meditate on the state of wisdom, which arises from the syllable OṀ in the vajra jewel.

original: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du shes pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du shes pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The vow is the ascertainment of what has been taught.

original: da ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the verse on the consecration of body, etc.🔽, he says,

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therein, etc.

original: gang gi sku grub par byed pa'i dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas de ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi sku grub par byed pa'i dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas de ni sgrub pa ste /
translated: The consecration is the consecration of the body, etc. of the Buddhas of the three times, which is accomplished by the body, etc. of the practitioner.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar sgrub pa'i sku byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar sgrub pa'i sku byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: It is the consecration of the body, which is the proximate means of attainment, because it is proximate by being the result of that.

original: de nyid kyis ngan 'gro rnams las sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sngom pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ngan 'gro rnams las sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sngom pa'o //
translated: It is the armor, because it protects from the miserable realms by means of that.

original: de nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum po gang yin pa'i yul yin pas de ni nye bar sgrub pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum po gang yin pa'i yul yin pas de ni nye bar sgrub pa'i yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the proximate means of attainment, because it is the object of the three verses.🔽It is stated:🔽The body of the Buddhas is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of speech.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.🔽It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.🔽It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.🔽It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.

original: sgrub pa'i sdom pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ste sgrub pa ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sdom pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ste sgrub pa ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.🔽It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.

original: de'i sdom pa ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sdom pa ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.

original: de nyid gang gi yul yin pa de la ni 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gang gi yul yin pa de la ni 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is stated:🔽The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor is the consecration of mind.🔽It is the object of the means of attainment, as before.🔽It is stated:

original: de nyid ni chos nyid kyi gsung lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni chos nyid kyi gsung lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The path of the Dharma is the object of the armor, which is the means of attainment.🔽The means of attainment is the Buddhas, and the armor

original: sgrub pa chen po'i sngom pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pa ste sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i sngom pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pa ste sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The object of the vow of great practice is the Buddhas.

original: de'i sdom pa ni thugs byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i sdom pa ni thugs byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The vow is the consecration of the mind, etc., as before.

original: de nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i gsum yin pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa gsum du slob dpon sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis don tsam blangs nas sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i gsum yin pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa gsum du slob dpon sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis don tsam blangs nas sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The three of the third verse are the three of the second verse, as taken by the master Buddhajñānapāda, who applied them to the meaning.

original: da ltar sangs rgyas rnams la bskul bas nyid kyi thugs dam bcas pa las nyams pa'i bsnyengs pas sgrub pa po la byin @193b gyis rlob pa nyid du mdzad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar sangs rgyas rnams la bskul bas nyid kyi thugs dam bcas pa las nyams pa'i bsnyengs pas sgrub pa po la byin @193b gyis rlob pa nyid du mdzad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that the Buddhas, being afraid of violating their own vow by being petitioned by the present Buddhas, do indeed consecrate the practitioner, he says, “The Buddhas, etc.”

original: drag shul gyis sgrub pa yang le'u bcu par gsungs pa'i bskul ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: drag shul gyis sgrub pa yang le'u bcu par gsungs pa'i bskul ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The forceful practice is also to be applied to the verses of urging taught in chapter ten.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o; ;
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o; ;
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter.🔽Chapter Thirteen

original: // le'u bcu gsum par sngags kyi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // le'u bcu gsum par sngags kyi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of mantra recitation in chapter thirteen begins with “Then” and so forth.

original: rigs dang sngags rnams thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rigs dang sngags rnams thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The characteristics of the body and so forth of all families and mantras are vajra repetition.

original: de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin//
analyzed: de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin//
translated: Then the teacher Vajradhara

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyi'i bzlas pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyi'i bzlas pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and so forth explains the general recitation.

original: sngags kun nyid ni don yin te de rnams kyi bzlas pa la rdo rje gsum gyi mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar rdo rje dbye ba gsum ste de'i mthar yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kun nyid ni don yin te de rnams kyi bzlas pa la rdo rje gsum gyi mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar rdo rje dbye ba gsum ste de'i mthar yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of all mantras is their recitation, which has the characteristic of being indivisible in the three vajras. It should be understood that this is the end of the three vajra divisions.

original: de'i bkod pa yang yin zhing rdo rje gsum yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bkod pa yang yin zhing rdo rje gsum yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is the array of those, and it is the three vajras, hence the name.

original: sku gsung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags bzlas pa'i rim gyis spros pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sku gsung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags bzlas pa'i rim gyis spros pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: By body, speech, etc., he teaches the emanation by the process of mantra recitation.

original: sku rdo rje'i sa bon las ni sku rdo rje nyid spro'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i sa bon las ni sku rdo rje nyid spro'o //
translated: From the seed of the body vajra, one should emanate the body vajra itself.

original: gsung dang thugs kyi sa bon dag las ni gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje nyid spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung dang thugs kyi sa bon dag las ni gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje nyid spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the seeds of speech and mind, one should emanate the speech vajra and the mind vajra, that is the meaning.

original: 'di nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su bsgoms nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su bsgoms nas /
translated: Having thus contemplated the body, speech, and mind of the Buddhas,

original: de rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod pa'i mchog brtag cing spro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod pa'i mchog brtag cing spro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: one should imagine the supreme worship of those with the goddesses of form, etc., and emanate them, and so forth.

original: ye shes rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa'i ye shes kyis gnyis su med pa'i bzlas pa dang spro ba la sogs pas nam mkha' lus khyab cing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul du bya'o zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa'i ye shes kyis gnyis su med pa'i bzlas pa dang spro ba la sogs pas nam mkha' lus khyab cing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul du bya'o zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
translated: The vajra of wisdom is the non-apprehensible wisdom, which should be done by way of the recitation and emanation of non-duality, etc. pervading the sky with the body, and passing from one to another.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du na cig car spro ba gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje so so las cig car nyid du sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du na cig car spro ba gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje so so las cig car nyid du sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje spro bar bya'o //
translated: Again, the simultaneous emanation is stated in Or else, etc. One should emanate the vajra of body, etc. simultaneously from each of the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams las kyang gzhan dag dang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams sam //
analyzed: de rnams las kyang gzhan dag dang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams sam //
translated: And from those, and likewise from the forms, etc., or else means or else from those, i.e., from the vajra of body, etc.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis thams cad du khyab par spro ba ni bsgom par bya'o //🔽ye shes sems dpa' spro ba gsungs pa ni lus dang ngag sems zhes bya @194a * //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis thams cad du khyab par spro ba ni bsgom par bya'o // ye shes sems dpa' spro ba gsungs pa ni lus dang ngag sems zhes bya @194a * //
translated: One should emanate the mandalas of those pervading everywhere.

original: ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The emanation of the wisdom-being is stated in The body, speech, and mind, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs bdag med tshul can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po ni phyogs gnyis la'ang ye shes kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyis cig car nyid du rab tu spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs bdag med tshul can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po ni phyogs gnyis la'ang ye shes kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyis cig car nyid du rab tu spro bar bya'o //
translated: The five Tathagatas, who are the nature of the body, speech, and mind of Nairatmya, should be simultaneously emitted by the seed of the Knowledge Being, called the “Knowledge Being mind,” on both sides.

original: dus gang gi tshe spro bar bya ba de gsungs pa ni brjod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sngags brjod pa'i dus su bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyi rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro bar bya'o //🔽de bas na yang /🔽bzlas la 'bad pa'i sems nyid ni //
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe spro bar bya ba de gsungs pa ni brjod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sngags brjod pa'i dus su bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyi rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro bar bya'o // de bas na yang / bzlas la 'bad pa'i sems nyid ni //
translated: He states the time when they are to be emitted: “Having recited,” etc. The Vajras, i.e., the Tathagatas, should be emitted in the manner just explained, at the time of reciting the mantra.🔽Therefore, he states the three verses beginning with:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: “The mind itself, striving in recitation,” etc.

original: rdzogs nas zhes bya ba ni sngags brjod pa'i mthar sku la sogs pa de rnams rang rang gi gnas rnams su bsdu bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs nas zhes bya ba ni sngags brjod pa'i mthar sku la sogs pa de rnams rang rang gi gnas rnams su bsdu bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: “Having completed,” etc. At the end of reciting the mantra, one should imagine that those bodies, etc. are reabsorbed into their respective places.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: And for that very reason,

original: yongs su sbas pa'i rig ma'i mchog rnams ni //
analyzed: yongs su sbas pa'i rig ma'i mchog rnams ni //
translated: the supreme knowledge consorts, well hidden,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de ltar sngags so sor brjod pa 'di lta bur bya'o zhes spyir bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngags so sor brjod pa 'di lta bur bya'o zhes spyir bshad nas /
translated: Having explained in general that the mantra should be recited in this way,🔽he declares the individual characteristics of the body, etc.,

original: sku la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: recitation.

original: sku yi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: sku yi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
translated: The perfect enlightenment of the Vajra Body

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste dngos po rnams bems po'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par dpyad cing rnam par 'jug pa ni sku rdo rje'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te de nyid ni sangs rgyas
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste dngos po rnams bems po'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par dpyad cing rnam par 'jug pa ni sku rdo rje'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te de nyid ni sangs rgyas
translated: is the perfect enlightenment of the Vajra Body, which is the analysis and engagement in the nature of the reality of things by way of the correct knowledge of the nature of the reality of the inert.

original: kyi sku zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: kyi sku zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: That itself is explained as the Buddha Body.

original: 'di ni sku'i bzlas pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sku'i bzlas pa yin par bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the body recitation.

original: gsung gi bzlas pa gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: gsung gi bzlas pa gsungs pa ni //
translated: The speech recitation is declared:🔽The perfect enlightenment of the pledge of speech

original: gsung gi dam tshig rdzogs byang chub //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsung gi dam tshig rdzogs byang chub //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: is the perfect enlightenment of the pledge of speech.

original: sgra'i ye shes ni so sor snang ba'i bdag nyid can te de sgra ma yin zhing tshig ma yin pa nyid du rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i ye shes ni so sor snang ba'i bdag nyid can te de sgra ma yin zhing tshig ma yin pa nyid du rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of sound is the nature of the individual appearances, and it is analyzed as not being sound and not being words.

original: sems gnas pa rdo rje nyid de gnas pa med pa nyid du rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni sems rnam par ngag pa'i bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rdo rje nyid de gnas pa med pa nyid du rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni sems rnam par ngag pa'i bzlas pa yin no //
translated: The vajra of the mind's abiding is analyzed as not abiding, and this is the recitation of the mind's complete purity.

original: don mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: don mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The nature of the equality of meaning is the Tathagatas,

original: de rjes su rtogs pa'i bzlas pas rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dang rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdzes pa dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnam par dpyad pa ni rin chen bzlas pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi'o //
analyzed: de rjes su rtogs pa'i bzlas pas rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dang rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdzes pa dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnam par dpyad pa ni rin chen bzlas pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi'o //
translated: and the recitation that realizes them is free from the nature of conceptualization and is the recitation of the jewel, which is the analysis of the beauty endowed with all aspects, the Buddhas of the three times, and Ratnasambhava.

original: gdon mi za ba'i bzlas pa gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas zhing ni zhes bya ba la sogs @194b pa ste bzhud cing byon pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i bzlas pa gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas zhing ni zhes bya ba la sogs @194b pa ste bzhud cing byon pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
translated: The recitation of the inevitable is stated with the buddhafields and so on. Going and coming refers to emanating and gathering.

original: de nyid rdo rje mchog ste dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje mchog ste dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That is the supreme vajra, the nature of the non-apprehensible.

original: khro bo la sogs pa'i bzlas pa gsungs pa ni khro bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sta /
analyzed: khro bo la sogs pa'i bzlas pa gsungs pa ni khro bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sta /
translated: The recitation of wrathful ones, etc. is stated:

original: khro bo'i dam tshig rdo rje yis //
analyzed: khro bo'i dam tshig rdo rje yis //
translated: By the pledge of the wrathful vajra,

original: zhas bya ba ni mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las rnams khro bo'i sgom pa la byung ba la ni rnab gcig nas gcig tu thos par khro bo'i sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig thos par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhas bya ba ni mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las rnams khro bo'i sgom pa la byung ba la ni rnab gcig nas gcig tu thos par khro bo'i sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig thos par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should recite the words of the wrathful mantra syllables, one after another, in the hearing of one who is engaged in the rite of wrathful meditation, such as the rite of assault, etc.

original: rang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor grags //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor grags //
translated: The sound of one's own vajra maṇḍala

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyis sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dod pa'i don gyis myos gyur pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyis sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod pa'i don gyis myos gyur pa //
translated: means the sound of the maṇḍala of wrathful ones.🔽One who is intoxicated by the meaning of desire

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par gyur cing myos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par gyur cing myos par gyur pa'o //
translated: means one who is afflicted and intoxicated by the meaning of desire.

original: kun du skyob cing phan par dga' //
analyzed: kun du skyob cing phan par dga' //
translated: One who delights in universal protection and benefit🔽means one who delights in the protection and benefit of all.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad la skyob pa'i don du phan tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad la skyob pa'i don du phan tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of “seeking the welfare of all.”

original: sems can gti mug gnas ni gti mug rnam par dag pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis spro zhing rnam par 'jog la sdud pa 'di ni gti mug rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gti mug gnas ni gti mug rnam par dag pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis spro zhing rnam par 'jog la sdud pa 'di ni gti mug rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation by way of the purification of delusion, in the sense of the expansion and arrangement of the abode of deluded sentient beings in the nature of Vairocana, the purification of delusion.

original: 'dod chags nyid ni rnam par dag pa yin pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid ni rnam par dag pa yin pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: Since passion itself is pure, it is a vajra.

original: de las byung bas na sngags kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshig ste lus la sogs pa lha'i tshul gyis yang dag par gnas nas spros par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung bas na sngags kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshig ste lus la sogs pa lha'i tshul gyis yang dag par gnas nas spros par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The words of the nature of the mantra, which arise from that, should be known as the expansion by means of the body, etc. abiding in the manner of the deity.

original: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa nyid ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa nyid ni rdo rje ste /
translated: The purification of hatred itself is a vajra.

original: de las byung ba'i sems sku la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par gnas par spro ba'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sems sku la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par gnas par spro ba'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The mind that arises from that should be known as the meditation by means of the manner of expansion of the body, etc. abiding in the manner of the deity.

original: zhe sdang gnas zhes bya ba la zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni mi bskyod pa ste /🔽de la rnam par gzhag cing bsdu'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gnas zhes bya ba la zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni mi bskyod pa ste / de la rnam par gzhag cing bsdu'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The abode of desire is Amitābha.🔽The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.🔽The abode of desire is Amitābha.

original: dam tshig de nyid rdo rje gsum //
analyzed: dam tshig de nyid rdo rje gsum //
translated: The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bshad do //
translated: The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.🔽The abode of desire is Amitābha.🔽The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.

original: rdo rje bdag po ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug ste bzlas pa la sogs pas 'dod chags las byung ba'i byang chub mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bdag po ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug ste bzlas pa la sogs pas 'dod chags las byung ba'i byang chub mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.🔽The abode of desire is Amitābha.🔽The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ces bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis longs spyod kyis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ces bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis longs spyod kyis so //
translated: The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.🔽The abode of desire is Amitābha.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po rdo rje can //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po rdo rje can //
translated: The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.

original: ma ning dag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dag gi @195a * //
analyzed: ma ning dag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dag gi @195a * //
translated: The abode of desire is Amitābha.🔽The abode of pride is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: gnas skabs dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi gnas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi gnas so //
translated: The abode of equanimity is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of hatred is Akṣobhya.🔽The abode of delusion is Amoghasiddhi.🔽The abode of jealousy is Vairocana.🔽The abode of desire is Amitābha.

original: zhe sdang gnas zhes bya ba la 'di'i don ni khros pa'i gnas skabs su zhe sdang gi ngo bo nyid las skyes pa ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang gnas zhes bya ba la 'di'i don ni khros pa'i gnas skabs su zhe sdang gi ngo bo nyid las skyes pa ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “The abode of hatred” means that in the state of anger, one is born from the essence of hatred, not from the Akṣhobhya family.

original: gsod la rtag tu brtson pa dag / ces bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis myur bar tha mal pa'i gzugs las rab tu 'pho bar byad pa'i phyogs de nyid kyis rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsod la rtag tu brtson pa dag / ces bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis myur bar tha mal pa'i gzugs las rab tu 'pho bar byad pa'i phyogs de nyid kyis rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Always striving to kill” means that by the power of the minds of the beings to be tamed, one quickly passes beyond the ordinary form, and by that very means one becomes accomplished.

original: mchog gi chos can la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog gi chos can la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For one of supreme Dharma” means

original: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du sngags kyi bzlas brjod la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du sngags kyi bzlas brjod la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: that one performs mantra recitation and so forth according to the rite.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa ni /
translated: The yoga of the drop is taught:

original: ye shes 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The wisdom wheel” and so forth.

original: ye shes 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The wisdom wheel” means

original: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i dbus su gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi 'khor lo la gnas par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i dbus su gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi 'khor lo la gnas par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: that one should meditate on the wheel in the center of the maṇḍala in the center of the heart of the gnosis being.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbus su zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbus su zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the center of that wheel,

original: zla ba la 'khor lo'i don zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma 'khor lo'i lte ba'i zla ba la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon thig le'i gzugs can du rang gi sems dang gnyis su med par bsgom pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas bya'o
analyzed: zla ba la 'khor lo'i don zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma 'khor lo'i lte ba'i zla ba la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon thig le'i gzugs can du rang gi sems dang gnyis su med par bsgom pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas bya'o
translated: the meaning of the wheel on the moon is the seed syllable located in the center of the wheel sign on the moon, which is meditated on as nondual with one’s mind in the form of a drop by a yogin of the family of Vairocana.

original: // de bzhin du 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin du 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: And so it is to be understood in the following cases as well.

original: thams cad du yang ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i thugs kar mtshan ma la sogs pa zla ba'i gdan la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i thugs kar mtshan ma la sogs pa zla ba'i gdan la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: And everywhere, the gnosis being and its sign, etc., are to be meditated on in the moon seat in the heart.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgras ni mi phyed pa la sogs par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i sgras ni mi phyed pa la sogs par bshad par bya'o //
translated: The words “vajra” and so on are to be explained as “indivisible” and so on.

original: de bas na de ltar brtags nas /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar brtags nas /
translated: Therefore, having imagined it thus,

original: rang snying dri ma med pa la //
analyzed: rang snying dri ma med pa la //
translated: in one’s own stainless heart,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: and so on, the three verses are stated.

original: yang sngags bzlas pa dang 'brel ba'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yang sngags bzlas pa dang 'brel ba'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: Again, the meaning connected with the recitation of the mantra is stated:

original: dkyil 'khor kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bdag po'i lha thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ngos bzhi po rnams su sangs rgyas lnga rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho gas dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bdag po'i lha thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ngos bzhi po rnams su sangs rgyas lnga rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho gas dgod par bya'o //
translated: All maṇḍalas and so forth. The five buddhas, Vairocana and so forth, should be placed in the four directions of the maṇḍala of all the lord deities, as stated.

original: de nas ye shes kyi sa bon de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od zer spro ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yi ge gsum dang spel bar bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi sa bon de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od zer spro ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yi ge gsum dang spel bar bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Then, the recitation should be done, combined with the three syllables, endowed with the emission of light rays of the five tathāgatas, the seeds of the gnoses.

original: sangs rgyas de dag dang @195b dkyil 'khor pa de dag thams cad kyang de'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de nyid gcig pu'i sa bon de de bzhin du zlos par gyur par bsgom par bya ste de las byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de dag dang @195b dkyil 'khor pa de dag thams cad kyang de'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de nyid gcig pu'i sa bon de de bzhin du zlos par gyur par bsgom par bya ste de las byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And all those buddhas and all those in the maṇḍala should be contemplated as just that single seed of the maṇḍala lord itself, reciting in that way. Enlightenment will be attained from that.

original: bye brag rnam pa gnyis su bsgrags //
analyzed: bye brag rnam pa gnyis su bsgrags //
translated: It is proclaimed to have two types.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of that.

original: sku gsum rdo rje'i bye phrag gis //
analyzed: sku gsum rdo rje'i bye phrag gis //
translated: With the three vajra bodies,

original: zhes bya ba la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: sku gsum zhes bya ba de kho na nyid gsum zlos pa ni rim gyis sam cig car spro ba 'di la ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: sku gsum zhes bya ba de kho na nyid gsum zlos pa ni rim gyis sam cig car spro ba 'di la ni nges pa med do //
translated: The so-called three bodies, the three realities, are recited, either gradually or all at once, but there is no certainty here.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ye shes kyi sa bon zlos pa ni rnam pa thams cad du cig car spro bar bya ste 'di ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ye shes kyi sa bon zlos pa ni rnam pa thams cad du cig car spro bar bya ste 'di ni nges pa yin no //
translated: The so-called vajra, the seed of gnosis, is recited, and all at once one should emit them. This is the certainty.

original: de ltar dbye ba rnam pa gnyis spro bar byas nas mchod pa la yang rang gi rigs nyid kyi lha mos mchod pa byed kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba rnam pa gnyis spro bar byas nas mchod pa la yang rang gi rigs nyid kyi lha mos mchod pa byed kyi /
translated: Having thus emitted the two kinds of emanations, one should also worship with the goddesses of one's own family.

original: rigs kyi bdag po gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni sku yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bdag po gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni sku yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: It is said that one should not worship with the lords of other families. The body is Vairochana.

original: sku'i ngo bo nyid spyan la sogs pas mchod par byed do //
analyzed: sku'i ngo bo nyid spyan la sogs pas mchod par byed do //
translated: The essence of the body, Lochana and so forth, should worship.

original: de bzhin du thugs la sogs pa la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs la sogs pa la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus it is to be applied to the mind and so forth.

original: spyan yang spro ba'i dus su rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang ldan par spro bar byed de /
analyzed: spyan yang spro ba'i dus su rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang ldan par spro bar byed de /
translated: When the eyes are emanated, they are emanated as endowed with the lord of one's mandala.

original: der yangs rnam par dag pa la rang gi gsang ba'i padmar sprul pa'i bdag po me long lta bur rnam par dag pa rnams par snang mdzad kyi 'byin pa'i sngags kyis de'i nang du chud pa dang ldan pa dang / me long lta bur rnam par dag pa'i dngos por thal bas spyan de me long lta bur rnam par dag pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: der yangs rnam par dag pa la rang gi gsang ba'i padmar sprul pa'i bdag po me long lta bur rnam par dag pa rnams par snang mdzad kyi 'byin pa'i sngags kyis de'i nang du chud pa dang ldan pa dang / me long lta bur rnam par dag pa'i dngos por thal bas spyan de me long lta bur rnam par dag pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: There, in the pure, vast space of one's secret lotus, the lord of emanation, pure as a mirror, is endowed with the mantra that produces Vairochana, which is contained within it, and is the consequence of being pure as a mirror.🔽Therefore, the eyes should be made pure as a mirror.

original: de bas na me long lta bur rnam par dag pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid ni de rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na me long lta bur rnam par dag pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid ni de rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since Vairochana, pure as a mirror, is pure by that purity,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that he is worshipped with the secret worship endowed with that nature, and not with others.

original: yang na gcig pu nyid sa rnam par dag pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: yang na gcig pu nyid sa rnam par dag pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Or, even if it is the case that the single one is pure as the earth,

original: rnam par snang mdzad nyid de'i rigs las byung ba yin pas na phyi'i mchod pas mchod pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad nyid de'i rigs las byung ba yin pas na phyi'i mchod pas mchod pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Since Vairocana is the one who arises from that family, there is no fault in worshipping with external worship.

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis na /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis na /
translated: By this very intention,

original: lha mo rnams ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi btsun mo'i mchog / ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lha mo rnams ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi btsun mo'i mchog / ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: the goddesses are the supreme queens of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin du m'a ma ka'i la sogs pa yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la mchod pa ci rigs par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du m'a ma ka'i la sogs pa yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la mchod pa ci rigs par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should explain the worship of Mamaki and so forth to Akshobya and so forth as appropriate.

original: da ni las rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa @196a * //🔽re zhig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni las rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa @196a * // re zhig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the four types of activities, [the Bhagavān] declares the accomplishment of the maṇḍala wheel.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, [the Bhagavān] declares the great maṇḍala, and so on.

original: rdo rje lnga rnams zhes bya ba da bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsgom par bya la /
analyzed: rdo rje lnga rnams zhes bya ba da bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsgom par bya la /
translated: The five vajras are the tathāgatas, which should be cultivated.

original: de rnams kyi dbus su gang gyur pa de ni bdag po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus su gang gyur pa de ni bdag po ste /
translated: The one who is in the middle of those is the lord.

original: rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i bdag po'i gzugs su bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i bdag po'i gzugs su bsams la /
translated: Having imagined the form of the lord endowed with the three vajras,

original: rang sngags rdo rje'i zhes bya ba bdag po'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i tshul de rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs rnam pa bzhi po dkar po la sogs pa kha dog rnam pa bzhir kun du brtags la snying
analyzed: rang sngags rdo rje'i zhes bya ba bdag po'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i tshul de rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs rnam pa bzhi po dkar po la sogs pa kha dog rnam pa bzhir kun du brtags la snying
translated: One should imagine the four forms of the mandala, white and so forth, with the colors of those in the manner of Vairochana and so forth, the members of the mandala of the lord, of one's own mantra-vajra.

original: po'i don ye shes kyi sa bon la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: po'i don ye shes kyi sa bon la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the essence, the seed of gnosis, and so forth.

original: 'di dag kyang dkyil 'khor thams cad nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang dkyil 'khor thams cad nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin te /
translated: These also have the meaning of illustrating all mandalas.

original: de ltar na dkyil 'khor de rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de ltar na dkyil 'khor de rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Thus, having visualized that mandala,

original: rdo rje rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnam pa bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnam pa bzhi bya'o //
translated: one should perform the four actions, such as pacification, with the four vajras.

original: gzhan dag kyang nus pa rnams las sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis re re'i las kyi nges pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang nus pa rnams las sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis re re'i las kyi nges pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Others, from among the powerful ones, have stated the certainty of each action by the power of the intention of sentient beings.

original: zhi ba la ni spyan gyi chu la //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni spyan gyi chu la //
translated: In pacification, in the water of the eye,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: zhi ba'i las la de bdag po'i lha dkar po'i tshul du bsam par bya ba dang / rgyas pa la 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshul ser po'i gzugs su bsam pa dang / dbang la rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba'i las la de bdag po'i lha dkar po'i tshul du bsam par bya ba dang / rgyas pa la 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshul ser po'i gzugs su bsam pa dang / dbang la rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
translated: For the subjugating activity, one should imagine him in the aspect of Vairocana.

original: zhes bya ba sgras dgod pa'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sgras dgod pa'i tshul gyis na /
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that

original: don yod par grub pa'i tshul dmar po'i rnam par gzung bar bya'o //🔽mngon spyod la ni khro bo'i tshul te nag por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don yod par grub pa'i tshul dmar po'i rnam par gzung bar bya'o // mngon spyod la ni khro bo'i tshul te nag por gnas pa'o //
translated: for the summoning activity, one should imagine him in the aspect of Amoghasiddhi as red.🔽For the wrathful activity, one should imagine him in the aspect of a wrathful one as black.

original: de la mngon spyod pa'i las rnams kyi yul gsungs pa ni ;
analyzed: de la mngon spyod pa'i las rnams kyi yul gsungs pa ni ;
translated: The domain of the wrathful activity is stated:

original: ma dad smra ba'i sems can dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad smra ba'i sems can dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Sentient beings who speak without faith,” and so on.

original: de nyid kyi cho ga gsungs pa ni khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi cho ga gsungs pa ni khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The procedure for that is stated: “The beings of the three realms,” and so on.

original: khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can ji snyed pa de kha sbyar dbye bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas sku'i bdag nyid can du rnam par bsgom par bya'o ;
